en: Malawi to Conduct Door-to-Door HIV Testing
sna: Malawi ichateedza imba neimba ichiongorora ropa maringe nedenda reshuramatongo

en: Malawians have mixed reactions to government plans to introduce door-to door HIV testing early next year.
sna: Vanhu vemuMalawi vane maonera akasiyana pamusoro pehurongwa hwehurumende hwekutanga kuongorora ropa kuitira reshuramatongo gore rinouya richingotanga, ichiita zvekuteedza imba neimba.

en: Supporters say the step is urgently needed because 100 Malawians get infected each day, and an average of 138 die from AIDS daily.
sna: Vanotsigira zano iri vanoti chirongwa ichi chinyanya kudiwa nekuti vanhu vemuMulawi zana vanobata chirwere ichi zuva nezuva, uye vanhu vangasvike zana nemakumi matatu nemasere vanofa nekuda kweshuramatongo zuva nezuva.

en: Minister of Health Jean Kalirani announced the plans during the recent commemoration of World AIDS Day in the northern district of Karonga.
sna: Gurokota rezvehutano Jean Kalirani avakazivisa hurongwa uhwu pamusi wekucherechedza zuva reshuramatongo reWorld AIDS Day rakaitwa muchinguva chichangodarika mudunhu rekumaodzanyemba reKaronga.

en: We will go in the villages asking for blood samples to check whether that person is HIV positive or not.
sna: Tichaenda kumamisha tichikumbira kutora madonhwe eropa kuti tione kuti munhu anedenda reshuramatongo here kana kuti kwete.

en: And those that will be found HIV positive will definitely be given the care they need.
sna: Vose vanenge vawanikwa vaine denda reshuramatongo zvirokwazvo vachapihwa kubatsirwa nekuchengetwa kwavanenge vachida.

en: And those who are found negative will also be counseled so that they remain negative, said Kalirani.
sna: Uye avo venenge vawanikwa vasina denda iri vachapihwa mazano kuitira kuti varambe vasina denda iri, akadaro Kalirani.

en: Kalirani said the campaign will start in mid-March and will aim to reach everyone in the country, including people who are far from health facilities that provide HIV testing and counseling services.
sna: Kalirani akati chirongwa ichi chichatanga pakati paKurume uye chichange chiine donzvo rekubata munhu wese munyika, kusanganisira vanhu vari kure nenzvimbo dzinobatsira nezvehutano nekuongorora ropa pane zveshuramatongo nekupa mazano nezvedenda iri.

en: She said the campaign is in line with the goal of ending HIV infection by 2030.
sna: Vakati hurongwa uhwu hwuri maringe nechinangwa chekupedza shuramatongo panosvika gore ra2030.

en: Malawi's HIV infection rate is currently at 10 percent, a slight drop from three years ago.
sna: Hwuwandu hwekupararira kwedenda reshuramatongo muMalawi ikezvino huri pazvikamu gumi kubva pazana, zvichiratidza kuderera zvishoma kubva pane zvakange zviri makore matatu apfuura.

en: The announcement has raised fears in some Malawians, such as Steven Jailosi, a primary school teacher in rural Blantyre, who feel the campaign will likely infringe upon peoples privacy.
sna: Chiziviso ichi chakaunza  kuvhunduka nekutya mukati mevamwe vanhu vemuMalawi, saSteven Jailosi, mudzidzisi wechikoro chevana vadiki mumaruwa eBlantyre, anofunga kuti chirongwa ichi chichabvongodza nekufumura zvhinhu zvevanhu zvavanoda kuti zvive zvakavanzikana.

en: I think it is not okay because they will be invading our privacy. HIV testing is supposed to be private.
sna: Handifunge kuti zvakanaka nekuti vanenge vopindira vasina kutenderwa kuti vazive zvakavanzikana zvedu.

en: No one is supposed to know that I went for an HIV testing unless I make a choice to tell them, said Jailosi.
sna: Kuongororwa ropa maringe nedenda resurmatongo chinofanirwa kuva chinhu chinoitwa pakavanzikana. Hapana anofanirwa kuziva kuti ndakaenda kunoongorwa ropa, kuzhe kwekuti ndaita sarudzo yekuvaudza, akadaro Jailosi.

en: Ester Makonokaya, a secretary in Blantyre, said that although she has been tested already, she feels the door-to-door HIV testing will violate people's privacy.
sna: Ester Makonokaya, anoshanda semunyori muBlantyre, akati kunyangwe akatoongorwa ropa rake kare, anofunga kuti zvekuteedza imba neimba kuchiongorora ropa maringe neshuramatongo zvinofumura zvakavanzikana zvevanhu.

en: Government should instead take the mobile clinics to the villages where people will be able to access them on their own rather than taking testing in their homes, because that might mean that some of the people who are not supposed to know other peoples status will know because, you know, when someone has been tested you show some reactions, said Makonokaya.
sna: Hurumende inofanirwa kuendesa zvipatara zvinotenderera zvichienda kumamisha uko vanhu vanogona kuzviendera vega vasarudza kudaro, pane zvekunovangorora ropa ravo mudzimba dzavo, nekuti izvi zvinogona kuita kuti vanhu vanga vasiingafanirwe kuziva chimiro chehutano hwemunhu vanopedzesera voziva, sezvamunozuiva, kana munhu angororwa ropa pane zvaunoita maringe nezvabuda mukuongorwa uku, akadaro Makonokaya.

en: Macpherson Maulana, a journalist in Blantyre and a producer of radio programs on health, told VOA that government would do better to educate Malawians on the need for HIV testing so that people will go for tests on their own "without being pushed."
sna: Macpherson Maulana, mutori wenhau muBlantyre uye ari mugadziri hwezvirongwa zvehutano pawairesi, akaudza VOA kuti zviri nani kuti hurumende idzidzise vanhu vemuMalawi zvakakoshera kuongororwa ropa kuti munhu azive kuti ane denda remashuratongo here kana kuti kwete, kuitira kuti vanhu vagozviita vega "vasina kusundwa nekumanikidzwa."

en: I fear it could end up into fights.
sna: I fear it could end up into fights. You see it happened in Liberia recently where people who were coming to help people suspected to have contracted Ebola were even killed. So, civic education is the most important element for people to be encouraged to come out for testing voluntarily, said Maulana.

en: So, civic education is the most important element for people to be encouraged to come out for testing voluntarily, said Maulana.
sna: Saka, dzidziso kuvagari ndicho chinhu chakanyanyokosha kuti vanhu vakurudzirwe kuti vabude vachizviuyira vega kuzoongororwa vasina kumanikidzwa, akadaro Maulana.

en: However, HIV/AIDS counselor David Odali, whose NGO Umunthu Foundation runs HIV-related projects, insisted privacy will be protected.
sna: Zvisineyi, mubatsiri anotaura nevanhu nekuvapa mazano pamusoro pechirwere cheshuramatongo anonzi David Odali, uyo ane sangano rake rinonzi NGO Umunthu Foundation rine zvirongwa zvine chekuita nedenda reshuramatongo, anosimbisa chose kuti pachave nekuchengetedza zvinofanirwa kuvanzwa zvemunhu.

en: Confidentiality will be upheld.
sna: Kuchengetedzeka kwezvakavanzikana zvevanhu kuchavepo. Ngatifungeyiwo pamusoro pemariro kaita misha yakasiyanana siyana. Ndinofunga kuti chimhu chekutanga kupa dzidziso nemazano kuvanhu vemhuri iyi. Hongu, vanhu vanogona kuongororwa vamwe vakatarisa, asi kana tasvika pakuzivisa zvabuda muongoro, anodzidzisa nekupa mazano ezvehutano anofanirwa kuudza mabuda muongoro kumunhu nemunhu akazvimiririra, akadaro Odali.

en: Lets consider the household setup.
sna: Ngatifungeyiwo pamusoro pemariro kaita misha yakasiyanana siyana. Ndinofunga kuti chimhu chekutanga kupa dzidziso nemazano kuvanhu vemhuri iyi. Hongu, vanhu vanogona kuongororwa vamwe vakatarisa, asi kana tasvika pakuzivisa zvabuda muongoro, anodzidzisa nekupa mazano ezvehutano anofanirwa kuudza mabuda muongoro kumunhu nemunhu akazvimiririra, akadaro Odali.

en: I think the first thing would be to provide group counseling to members of that family.
sna: Ndinofunga kuti chinhu chekutanga kupa dzidziso nemazano kuvanhu vemhuri iyi.

en: [Of course] people can be tested while others are watching, but when it comes to disclosing the results, a counselor is supposed to disclose that results to each and every individual separately, said Odali.
sna: Hongu, vanhu vanogona kuongororwa vamwe vakatarisa, asi kana tasvika pakuzivisa zvabuda muongoro, anodzidzisa nekupa mazano ezvehutano anofanirwa kuudza mabuda muongoro kumunhu nemunhu akazvimiririra, akadaro Odali.

en: Odali said it will be up to the person who has been tested to disclose his or her status.
sna: Odali akati zvinenge zviri kumunhu anenge aongororwa kuti azivise kuti ropa rake rakamira papi.

en: In 2006, the charity Development Aid from People to People conducted door-to-door HIV testing in the district of Thyolo and Blantyre, reaching 400,000 people.
sna: Odali said it will be up to the person who has been tested to disclose his or her status.

en: The organization says it worked well.
sna: In 2006, the charity Development Aid from People to People conducted door-to-door HIV testing in the district of Thyolo and Blantyre, reaching 400,000 people. The organization says it worked well.

en: Water Crisis Raises Fears of Waterborne Disease in Malawi
sna: Kushaikwa Kwemvura Kokonzera Kutyira Zvirwere Zvinaowanikwa Mumvura MuMalawi

en: Malawians in the country's commercial capital, Blantyre, usually rely on tap water.
sna: Vanhu veBlantyre, guta guru pane zvehupfumi muMalawi, vanowanzoshandisa mvura inobuda mupombi.

en: But for the past five months, the taps have often run dry, forcing residents to draw water from unprotected sources like rivers and wells, while work is being done at the city main pumping station.
sna: Asi kwemwedzi mishanu yadarika mapombi aya angaoma kuti papata, izvo zviri kumanikidza vagari kuti vachere mvura kubva munzvimbo dzisina kuchengetedzeka zvakaita senzizi yematsime, vakamirira kuti basa rekugadzirisa mishina inopomba mvura muguta iri.

en: The risk of contracting water-borne diseases is rising.
sna: Njodzi yekubata zvirwere zvinogara mumvura iri kuramba ichisimuka.

en: In Blantyre and surrounding areas, residents have spent five days without tap water.
sna: MuBlantyre nenzvimbo dzakaipoteredza, vagari vakagara mazuva mashanu vasina mvura inobuda mupombi.

en: Women, who by Malawi tradition are responsible for household tasks, complain of the risks they face when fetching water from rivers far from residential areas.
sna: Madzimayi, avo maringe netsika yemuMalawi vanoita mabasa epamba, vanogun'una pamusoro penjodzi dzavanosangana nadzo pavanochera mvura kubva munzizi dziri munzvimbo dzinogara vanhu.

en: Rhoda Milanzi, a housewife and mother of three, tells VOA the journeys through bushy footpaths are risky.
sna: Rhoda Milanzi, mudzimayi anogara pamba vari mai vevana vatatu, vsnoudza VOA kuti zhiras dzekupfuura nemuzvikwenzi dzine njodzi.

en: "We wake up every day 2 a.m., sometimes 1 a.m., to go and collect water.
sna: "Tinomuka pakati pehusiku, nguva dzeku 2 a.m., dzimwe nguva kuma 1 a.m., kuti tiende kunochera mvura.

en: There are so many risks.
sna: Kune njodzi dzakawanda.

en: You see, sometimes we would meet witches, snakes on the way," she says, "even hyenas have been chasing us."
sna: Unoona, dzimwe nguva taisanga nevaroyi, nenyoka muzhira," anodaro, "kunyangwe mapere anotitandanisa."

en: Milanzi says to ease the burden of carrying water home for bathing, women prefer to bathe in the river.
sna: Milanzi anoti kuti zvisanyanye kuvaremera kusenga mvura yakawanda yekugeza, madzimayi avakusarudza kugeza murwizi.

en: But she says they have been disturbed by youths who hide in the nearby bush.
sna: Asi anoti vanokanganiswa nevechidiki vanenge vakahwanda muzvikwenzi zviri pedyo.

en: These youths of today would come there and hide somewhere to see us naked.
sna: Vechidiki vanhasi ava vaiuya ipapo vagohwandira kuti vatione takashama.

en: This has been a major embarrassment.
sna: Changa chiri chinyadzo chikuru.

en: In fact we complained to the chiefs about it.
sna: Takatozonogunun'una kumadzimambo pamusoro penyaya iyi.

en: They punished some of them, but you know they would sometimes climb trees just to look at older women like us taking a bath, she explains.
sna: Vakaranga vamwe vavo, asi unozviva, dzimwe nguva vaikwira mumiti kuti vangoona madzimayi makuru akaita sesu tichigeza, anotsanangura achidaro.

en: The water problem also has affected the delivery of health services.
sna: Dambudziko remvura iri rakabva rakanganisa kuwanikwa kwezvehurano.

en: Three weeks ago, authorities at Queen Elizabeth Central Hospital in Blantyre confirmed that they had suspended surgical operations due to water scarcity.
sna: Masvondo matatu apfuura, vakuru vepachipatara cheQueen Elizabeth Central Hospital muBlantyre vakabvuma kuti vakange vamisa kurapa kunosanganisira kucheka nekuvhura mitezo yemiviri yevanhu nekuda kwekushaikwa kwemvura.

en: Health rights campaigners warn of the possible outbreak of waterborne diseases, especially in densely populated areas, if the situation is left unresolved.
sna: Vanorwira kodzero dzezvehutano vanoyambira kuti panogona kutushuka zvirwere zvinogara mumvura, zvikuru munzvimbo dzinogara vanhu vakawnda, kana nyaya iyi ikasagadziriswa.

en: Officials at the Blantyre Water Board attribute the problem largely to an ongoing European Union-funded project that seeks to install new pumping machines at Walkers Ferry, the main pumping station.
sna: Vashandi vakuru pabazi rinoona nezvemvura yemuguta iri, yeBlantyre Water Board vanoti dambudziko iri riri kubva pabasa riri kubhadharirwa mari neEuropean Union rekiisa mishina yekupomba mvura paWalkers Ferry, panova ndipo pane mishina mikuru yekumba mvura.

en: Priscilla Mateyu, the spokesperson for the Blantyre Water Board, says the project is expected to increase water production capacity to 105,000 cubic meters per day from the current daily production of 78,000 cubic meters.
sna: Priscilla Mateyu, mutauriri weBlantyre Water Board, anoti basa iri riri kutarisirwa kuwedzera mvura inopombwa kuti isvike kuzviuru zana nezvishanu zvema cubic meters pazuva kubva pa cubic metre zviuru makumi manomwe nemaserenari kupombwa pazuva iyezvino.

en: January is when the project is finishing.
sna: Ndira ndipo pari kupera basa iri.

en: But for the new machines and everything else to start working properly, we have to wait until March [2015].
sna: Asi kuitira mishina mitsva nezvimwe zvese kuti zvinyatsoshanda zvakanaka, tinotofanira kumiririra kusvikira Kukadzi wa2015.

en: That's when we expect the levels would increase and also production capacity improving to least what we expect it to be, Mateyu said.
sna: Ndipo patiri kutarisira kuti huwandu hwemvura hunenge hwakwirira uyewo nekuwedzera kwegoneso yekuburitsa mvura yakawanda inenge ichiitawo zviri nani kusvikira yasvika patinoitarisira kuti ive, Mateyu akadaro.

en: The local consumer rights watchdog, the Consumers Association of Malawi, had been planning to hold vigils at the water board until the water supply was normalized, but the board asked protesters to hold off, promising to distribute water to residents through mobile water tanks.
sna: Sangano rinorwira kodzero dzevatengi muMalawi reConsumers Association of Malawi, rakange ricironga kuita mapungwe pamahofisi ebazi rinoona nezvemvura kusvikira nyaya yemvura yagadziriswa uye mvura yavakubuda mumapombi, asi bazi iri rakati vaida kuratidzira vambomira izvozvo, ndokubva vavimbisa kuunza mvura kuvagari vachishandisa matangi anotendera nemvura.

en: The consumer rights group has given the water board two weeks to fulfill its commitment before proceeding with the protests.
sna: Sangano iri rakapa bazi rezvemvura kuti rizadzikise chivimbiso charo pasati pava nekuratidzira.

en: Malawi President Under Fire for Giving Money to Journalists
sna: Mutungamiriri weMalawi Opinda Mumoto Nekupa Vatapi Venhau Mari

en: Malawi President Peter Mutharika is under fire for giving envelopes containing $125 to more than 80 media people at a dinner he hosted last month in Blantyre.
sna: Mutungamiriri weMalawi vaPeter Mutharika vakapinda mumoto neuti vakapa mahamvuropu ane zana nemakumi maviri ne mashanu emadhora kuvatapi venhau vanodarika makumi masere pamabiko avakaita mwedzi wadarika muBlantyre.

en: The editor of the privately owned Times Television said reporters were told the envelopes contained the presidents plans for the media - which has been critical of the governments economic performance.
sna: Mupepeti wesangano renhau risiri rehurumende rinonzi Times Television akati vatapi venhau vakaudzwa kuti hamvuropu idzi dzaive nehurongwa hwemutungamiriri wenyika pamusoro pamasangano enhau, ayo anga achitsoropodza zvirikuitwa nehurumende mune zvehupfumi hwenyika.

en: In his column published in Malawis Sunday Times newspaper, editor Grecian Tukula said he was not sure why the money was given to journalists at the state dinner.
sna: Muchinyorwa chake chakaburitswa mubepanhau remuMalawi rinonzi Sunday, mupepeti Grecian Tukula akati akange asina chokwadi chekuti seyi mari iyi yakapihwa vapepeti venhau pamabiko ehurumende aya.

en: Tukula said he initially decided to return the money but reversed the decision to avoid "creating a scene."
sna: Tukula akati akange asarudza kudzorera mari iyi asi ndokuzoshandura pfungwa iyi kuti "asakonzere bopoto."

en: But the editor for the Weekend Nation newspaper, George Kasakula, told VOA that he returned the money right away.
sna: Asi mupepeti webepanhau rinonzi Weekend Nation, George Kasakula, akaudza VOA kuti akabva adzorera mari iyi ipapo.

en: I just felt it was not right for me to receive the money, so I returned it.
sna: Ndakangonzwa mandiri kuti zvakange zvisina kunaka kuti nditambire mari iyi, saka ndakabva ndaidzorera.

en: My understanding is that if someone invites me to a workshop, its their duty to ensure that they feed me, they accommodate me and they transport me.
sna: Kunzwisisa kwandiinako ndekwekuti kana munhu akandikoka kumusangano uri maringe nebasa ravanoita, ibasa ravo kuona kuti vandipa zvekudya, vondipa pekugara nezvekufambisa.

en: But in this case, I didnt see why I should get that allowance because I didnt spend anything to go to Sanjika [Palace], said Kasakula.
sna: Asi pachiitiko ichi, handina kuona kuti sei ndaifanirwa kupihwa mari iyi nekuti handina chandakashandisa kuti ndiende kumuzinda wemutungamiriri,wenyia, unonzi Sanjika Palace, akadaro Kasakula.

en: The issue has attracted more public attention after privately owned Capital Radio aired a story questioning the meaning of the cash handouts from the president.
sna: Nyaya iyi yakwezvawo vanhu veruzhinji mushure mekunge wayiresi isiri mumaoko ehurumende inonzi Capital Radio yakatepfenyura nyaya yaibvunza chirevo chekupa musvo wemari kwakaitwa uku ichibva kumutungamiriri wenyika.

en: As Capital FM we serve the interest of the public.
sna: Isu seCapital FM tiripo kuita zvido zveveruzhinji. Nyaya iyi yange yakatekeshera pamadandemutande enhaurirano pamapotonjrtr nenharembozha, uye kunyangwe isu sevenhau, maonerowo edu, kuti takapinzwawo munyaya iyi, saka zvakakosha zvikurusa kuti titeedza munyatso wenyaya iyi kusvikira tasvika pamudzi wayo chaiwo, akadro Steven Dakalira,anotungamirira chikamu chezvenhau nezvirikuitika paCapital Radio.

en: This issue has been all over the social media, and even we as a media are implicated [we believe] it is paramount that we follow up and get to the bottom of the matter, said Steven Dakalira, the head of news and current affairs at Capital Radio.
sna: Nyaya iyi yange yakatekeshera pamadandemutande enhaurirano painternet nenharembozha, uye kunyangwe isu sevenhau, maonerowo edu, kuti takapinzwawo munyaya iyi, saka zvakakosha zvikurusa kuti titeedza munyatso wenyaya iyi kusvikira tasvika pamudzi wayo chaiwo, akadro Steven Dakalira,anotungamirira chikamu chezvenhau nezvirikuitika paCapital Radio.

en: In his column in the Nyasa Times, Malawi professor of law Danwood Mzikenge Chirwa said what President Mutharika did by giving money handouts to journalists at a news event was tantamount to bribery.
sna: Muchinyorwa chvo chakabuda mubepanhau reNyasa Times, muzvinafundo mune zvemutemo wemuMalawi Danwood Mzikenge Chirwa vakati zvakaitwa nemutungamiriri wenyika vaMutharika zvekutambidza mari kuvatapi venhau pachiitiko chenhau zvaange zvakafanana nefufuro.

en: He has called on Mutharika to resign or face impeachment proceedings.
sna: Vakati vaMutharika vanofanirwa kunyora tsamba yekusiya basa kana kuti vomanikidzwa zviri pamutemo kuti vasiye basa nekuti vakatyora mutemo wenyika.

en: Local civil society groups said that "by attempting to bribe the journalists" Mutharika subjected his leadership style to disrepute.
sna: Masangano anorwira kodzero dzevanhu dzakati "nekuti vakaedza kupa fufuro kuvatapi venhau" vaMutharika vakabva vaderedza kuhutungamiriri hwavo kuti humhurwe.

en: Meanwhile, some journalists are donating the money to charity.
sna: Zvichakadayi, vamwe vatapi venhau varikupa mari iyi kuti ibatsire vanotambura nekushaiwa.

en: Brian Ligomeka, the Managing Editor for the Times Group, told Times Television that all four employees there have donated the money to an orphanage.
sna: Brian Ligomeka, mupepeti anotungamirira kana kuti Managing Editor wesangano renhau rinonzi the Times Group, akaudza Times Television kuti vatapi venhau vana vesangano rake vaiveko vakapa mari iyi kumusha unochengeta nherera.

en: At first we decided to return the money to the president but we later thought it wise to buy assorted items like sugar, salt, notebooks and donate it to needy children, said Ligomeka.
sna: Pakutanga takasarudza kudzosera mari iyi kumutungamiriri wenyika, asi takazosarudza kutenga zvinhu zvakasiyana siyana zvakaita setsvigiri, munyu, mabhuku ekunyorera nekuzozvipa kuvana vanotambura, akadaro Ligomeka.

en: In his latest Sunday Times column, Raphael Tenthani, who also writes for BBC, apologized on behalf of other journalists "for letting down the public that trust journalists unreservedly."
sna: Muchinyorwa chake chinobuda mubepanhau reSunday Times, Raphael Tenthani, uyo anonyorerawo BBC, akakumbira ruregerero akamiririea vamwe vatapi venhau "nekurasisa veruzhinji vanovimba nevatapi venhau pasina kukahadzika."

en: Tenthani has since donated the money for charity work and said that although the journalists could have done better if they returned the money right away, doing so would have been perceived as disrespect to the head of state.
sna: Tenthani akazopa mari iyi kuti ibatsire vanoshaya, uye akati kunyangwe hazvo vatapi venhau vaizenge vakaita zviri nani  deno kuri kunzi vakabva vadzorera mari iyi ipapo, kuita zvakadaro zvinga dai zvakaonekwa sekusaremekedza mukuru wenyika.

en: Maclan Kanyangwa, who heads the Department of Journalism and Media Studies at the Polytechnic College of the University of Malawi, said a media code of ethics bars journalists from accepting payment on a story.
sna: Maclan Kanyangwa, uyo anotungamirira bazi rezvekudzidza zvekutapa nhau reDepartment of Journalism and Media Studies paPolytechnic College of the University yemumaMalawi, akati zvisungo zvemabatirwo ebasa rekutapa nhau nodzivisa vatapi venhau kuti vagamuchire mari nekuti vane nyaya vanyora.

en: Obviously the meeting at the palace was the newsworthy event.
sna: Zviri pachena kuti musangano uyu pamuzinda wemutungamiriri chaive chinhu chinokosha panyaya dzekutapa nhau.

en: There was a possibility that something was going to be published.
sna: Paive nemukana wekuti chimwe chinhu chaizoziviswa.

en: And in the event that this payment would have influenced journalist decision [on news judgment], then that becomes a problem, said Kanyangwa.
sna: Uye pamutambo uyu kuzobhadhara vatapi venhau kuti varunzirwe pamanyorero avo nhau izvi zvaizounza dambudziko, akadaro Kanyangwa.

en: Kanyangwa said he feels many journalists failed to return the money immediately because they might have been out of their ethical senses when they got the money.
sna: Kanyangwa akati anofunga kuti vatapi venhau vazhinji vakakonewa kudzosera mari iyi ipapo nekuti vakange varivara panyaya yezvisungo zvehunhu hwevatapi venhau panguva yavakatambira mari iyi.

en: Efforts to talk to Presidential Press Officer Fredrick Ndala were not successful.
sna: Zvose zvakaitwa kutaura nemubati webasa rezvenhau muhofisi yemutungamiriri wenyika kana kuti Presidential Press Officer, vaFredrick Ndala, hazvina kubudirira.

en: But some government authorities say the payment was not a bribe but meant for a fuel refund to those who attended the night event.
sna: Asi vamwe vakuru vehurumende vanoti kubhadharwa uku kwaisava kufufura asi yaiva mari yekutsiva mari yakange yashandiswa kuenga mafuta edimotokari dzeavo vakauya kumi=utambo wakaitwa manheru uyu.

en: Report: Manufacturing Could Free Poorest Nations From Poverty
sna: Nhau: Kugadzira Zvinhu Kunogona Kudzikinura Nyika Dzakaromboka Kudarika Dzimwe Kubva Kuhurombo

en: A new United Nations report urges the poorest countries in the world to shift from low- to high-productivity activities to improve their economies.
sna: A new United Nations report urges the poorest countries in the world to shift from low- to high-productivity activities to improve their economies.

en: In its annual Least Developed Countries Report, UNCTAD the U.N. Conference on Trade and Development says these countries must structurally transform their economies to free themselves from the "poverty trap," which is stunting economic growth and development.
sna: Muchinyorwa chayo cheongoro netsvarukudzo chegore pamusoro penyika dziri pazasi zasi pane zvebudiriro kana kuti Least Developed Countries Report, bazi remubatanidzwa wenyika dzose rinoona nezvekutengeserana nebudiriro reUN Conference on Trade and Development kana kuti UNCTAD rinoti nyika idzi dzinofanirwa kushanduro hwaro nemamiriro ezvehupfumi hwadzo kuti dzvizvipukunyutse kubva "pachikirimbani chehurombo"- icho chiri kumisa kukura nekubudirira pazvehupfumi.

en: Of the 48 nations the U.N. considers "Least Developed Countries" (LDCs), only one, Laos, is on track to achieve all seven of the Millennium Development Goals (MDG's) by 2015.
sna: Pakati penyika makumi mana nesere dzinonzi neU.N. ndidzo dzisina kubudirira zvachose kudarika dzimwe nyika, kana kuti "Least Developed Countries" (LDCs), panongova neimwe chete, nyika ye Laos, iri mugwara kuti ikunde pazviga zvinomwe zvebudiriro kana kuti Millennium Development Goals (MDG's) panozosvika gore ra2015.

en: Only four African countries Ethiopia, Malawi, Rwanda and Uganda are likely to meet a majority of these targets.
sna: Nyika ina dzoga muAfrica dzinoti Ethiopia, Malawi, Rwanda and Uganda ndidzo dzingangokwanisa kuzadzikisa zvizhinji zvezviga izvi.

en: This assessment is particularly grim in light of the even greater challenges awaiting these countries in the coming years.
sna: Ongororo iyi irikubva yaunza rima nekuda kwezvimwe zvidenho zvakatarisana nyika idzi mumakore ari kumberi

en: The MDGs set a goal for nations to halve their poverty levels by 2015.
sna: Zviga zvema MDGs zvakapa chinangwa kunyika kuti dzidambure nepakati zviyero zvehurombo hwadzo panosvika gore ra2015.

en: The so-called Sustainable Development Goals, which carry on from where the MDGs leave off, call for eradication of poverty by 2030.
sna: Zvimwe zviga zvebudiriro inogona kuzadzikisika kana kuti Sustainable Development Goals, izvo zvonoendera mberi nebasa rinenge rasiiwa nema MDGs, zvinodanidzirawo kuti hurombo hunge hwaparadzwa nekupedzwa panozosvika gore ra 2030.

en: According to Taffere Tesfachew, an UNCTAD official who works with African nations, it would be nothing short of a miracle for the LDCs to pull this off.
sna: Semaonero aTaffere Tesfachew, mubati webasa muUNCTAD anoshanda nenyika dzemuAfrica, zvinotoda chishamiso choga kuti ndudzi dzisina kubudirira kudarika dzimwe kana kuti ma LDCs dzikunde apa.

en: In order for the least developed countries to achieve this miraculous performance, he says they will need to structurally change their economies.
sna: Kuti nyika dzine budiriro shomanana kudarika dzimwe dzigone kuita chishamiso ichi, anoti dzinofanirwa dzinofanirwa kushandura mamiriro nemashandiro anoita zvehupfumi hwadzo.

en: He tells VOA this means shifting labor from activities with low productivity, such as small-scale agriculture and services to more dynamic activities with higher productivity, such as manufacturing and high-value services.
sna: Anoudza VOA kuti izvi zvinoreva kubvisa vashandi kubva kumabasa anounza pundutso shoma, zvakaita sekurima patwuminda twudoko nemabasa vachienda kumabasa anounza pundutso nekukasira akaita sekugadzira zvinhu nemidziyo nekushanda mabasa anokosheswa nevanhu.

en: Countries that have moved up are the ones that are creating opportunities for those that are leaving agriculture to engage in things where they add value, where they get training and as it happens, manufacturing tends to have that sort of feature, that is why this call for manufacturing, he said.
sna: Nyika dziri kukwirira ndedziya dziri kusika mikana kune vaye vava kusiya zvekurima vachiita mamwe mabasa anowedzera hukoshi hwezvigadzirwa, uko vari kuwana kudzidziswa kwekushanda nemaoko, uye pazvinoitika izvi bazi rezvekugadzira zvinhu rine chinhu ichi, ndokusaka paine kukurudzira panyaya yekugadzira zvinhu, akadaro

en: "Countries that are using policies to shift and influence capital and labor to move into this activity sector tend to do better."
sna: "Nyika dziri kushandisa hwaro hwekushanda kwehurumende dzadzo kuti dzifambise nekukonzera mari nevashandi kuti vapinda muchikamu ichi dziri kuita zviri nani."

en: Tesfachew says these high-productivity sectors tend to pay higher wages and create a demand for goods.
sna: Tesfachew anoti zvikamu izvi zvinoburitsa zvigadzirwa zvakawanda zvinopawo mihoro yepamusoro uye inosika mukana wekuti pave nekuda kutengwa kwezvigadzirwa zvazvo.

en: This, he says, encourages investment.
sna: Anoti izvi zvinokurudzira nekukoka kuuya kwemari inopfimbikwa mumamabhindauko nemabhizimisi.

en: On the surface, it appears that the LDCs are not doing badly.
sna: Zvichitariswa nepanze, zvinoita sekuti nyika dziri muchikwata chema LDCs hadzisi kuita zvakanyanya kuipa hadzo.

en: UNCTAD economic data show growth in these poor countries between 2002 and 2008 exceeded the seven percent target set by the international community.
sna: Hwerengedzo yeUNCTAD pane ruzivo rwezvirikuitika mune zvehupfumi munyika rombo idzi pakati pa2002 na2008 yakadarika chiga chezvikamu zvinomwe muzana chakanganchatarwa nenyika dzepasi rose.

en: And, even after the 2008 financial crisis, UNCTAD notes the LDCs grew faster than other developing countries, at an average of 5.7 percent per year.
sna: Uye kunyangwe mushure memhirizhonga yezvehupfumi yemugore ra2008, UNCTAD inoti nyika dziri muboka remaLDCs dzakakura nekukasira kudarika dzimwebnyika dzichiri kusimukira, dziri pachiyero chezvikamu zvishanu zvine chidimbu chinomwe kubva muzana pagore.

en: But U.N. economists say the outlook for the least developed countries in the short and medium term remains uncertain.
sna: Asi nyanzvi dzezvehupfumi dzeU.N. dzinoti remangwana renyika dzisina kubudirira kudarika dzimwe dzese munguva iri pedyo pedyo nenguva nenguva iri pakati nepakati inouya rinoramba risina kujeka.

en: They say increasing peoples productivity is the best way to break the patter of human and economic underdevelopment that continues to entrap them in poverty.
sna: Nyanzvi idzi dzinoti kuwedzera goneso yevanhu kuti vasike nekugadzira zvinhu ndiyo nzira yakanakisisa yekutyora tsika zvekushaikwa kana kudopoka kwebudiriro yevanhu nezvehupfumi kunovabata muriva rehurombo.

en: UN: Most African Nations to Miss 2015 MDG Goals
sna: UN Inoti: Nyika Zhinji DzemuAfrica Dzichapotsa Zviga Zvebudiriro kana kuti Ma MDG Zvegore ra2015

en: Most African countries will not reach the Millennium Development Goals set for 2015 because of the gap between economic and human development.
sna: Nyika Zhinji DzemuAfrica Dzichapotsa Zviga Zvebudiriro kana kuti Ma MDG Zvegore zvakatemerwa gore ra2015 nekuda kwemukaha uripo pakati pe budiriro yezvehupfumi nebudiriro iri muvanhu.

en: That is one of the conclusions in this years annual U.N. report on the Least Developed Countries, presented Thursday.
sna: Ichi ndicho chimwe chezvinhu chakabuda muchinyorwa cheongororo netsvakurudzo chegore pamusoro penyika dzine budiriro shomanana kudarika dzimwe dzose kana kuti Least Developed Countries (LCDs), chakaturwa nemusi weChina.

en: Junior Davis, U.N. economic affairs officer for Africa, said African countries have not been able to translate their economic growth into structural transformation.
sna: Junior Davis, mushandi weU.N. anoona nezvehupfumi muAfrica, akati nyika dzemuAfrica hadzina kunge dzichikwanisa kushandura kukura kwezvehupfumi hwadzo kuti huburitse kukura neshanduko yezvinhu zvinobatika zvadzinenge dzavaka.

en: We think that is the case because these countries have not focused efficiently on building what we call their productive capacities, Davis said.
sna: Tinofunga kuti ndizvo zviri kuitika nekuti nyika ridzi hadzina kunangisa zvakakwana pakuvaka zvatinodaidza kuti goneso yavo yekushanda zvine pundutso, akadaro Davis.

en: "These are the basic human and economic development capacities that are needed to promote sustainable economic development. And the MDG, as they were constructed, largely ignored the need to develop the productive capacities."
sna: "Idzi igoneso dzinofanirwa kuvepo dzebudiriro yevanhu nepane zvehupfumi dzinodiwa kuti dziunze budiriro mune zvehupfumi inochengeteka kuti irambe ichiendera mberi. Uye maMDG, semagadzirirwo aakaitwa, kazhinji akange asine hanya nekuvaka goneso dzekushanda zvinopa pundutso."

en: Slow progress
sna: Budiriro iri kunonoka

en: African countries also are not on course to halve poverty by 2015, and their overall progress on reducing hunger is relatively slow.
sna: Nyika dzemu Africa hadzisi zvakare munzira yekudambura nepakati huwandu nehudzamu hwehurombo panosvika gore ra2015, uye budiriro yadzo pakuderedza nzara iri kunonoka.

en: Poverty limits human development and undermines productivity.
sna: Hurombo hunoderedza kusimukira kwevanhu uye kunokanganisa goneso yekushanda zvine pundutso.

en: And economic development is needed to make gains in human development.
sna: Uyewo budiriro yezvehupfumi inodikanwa kuti pave nechimuko panezvekubudirira kwevanhu.

en: Ethiopia, Rwanda, Uganda and Malawi are the only African countries on track to reach the majority of the development goals.
sna: Ethiopia, Rwanda, Uganda neMalawi ndidzo chete nyika adziri mugwara rekuzadzikisa zvizhinji zvezvinangwa zvebudiriro izvi.

en: They are making progress because they heavily invested in areas that create sustainable development such as infrastructure, health and education.
sna: Dziri kufambira mberi nekuti dzakaisa mari zhinji muzvikamu zvinounza budiriro inoenderera mberi yakaita sezvivakwa, hutano nezvekudzidza.

en: The post-2015 development agenda for fragile countries where governance remains an issue such as South Sudan and the Democratic Republic of Congo will still largely depend on support from the international community to achieve social and economic development, Davis said.
sna: Hurongwa hwebudiriro mushure megore ra 2015 kuitira nyika ndonda umo kutonga nekutungamirira zvichiri matambudziko dzakaita seSouth Sudan neDemocratic Republic of Congo hucharangwa hwakazembera parubatsiro rwekune dzimwe nyika dzepasi rose kuti dzigone kuva nebudiriro yemumagariro evanhu nepane zvehupfumi, Davis akadaro.

en: Improvements in rural development, industrial productivity, agriculture and the services sectors in these countries will require "ways in which we can have a pattern of growth which is not just sustainable but jobs-rich," Davis said.
sna: Kukwidziridza budiriro mumaruwa, kuwedzera zvinobuda nepundutso mumakambani anogadzira zvinhu nemidziyo, zvekurima uye nemapoka ezvehupfumo anoita basa rekupa nekubatsira vanhu zvinhu zvavanoda nekushandisa misi nenguva zviri munyika idzi zvichada "nzira dzekuti panenge paine gwara rekukura nekusimukira risingangoratidze kuti rinogara riripo asiwo rinounza mabasa nazhinji," Davis akadaro.

en: "Because we see the growth in jobs and employment is central to any development strategy that aims to reduce poverty in a sustainable way."
sna: "Nekuti tinoona budiriro mumabasa uye kuwana basa kwakakosha chaizvo pahurongwa hupi zvahwo hungavepo hwekuderedza hurombo nenzira inogara iripo."

en: A country is placed on the Least Developed Countries list based on its per capita income, economic vulnerability, and human development indicators such as health and nutrition.
sna: Nyika inozoiswa pachikwata chenyika dzine budiriro shomanana kudarika dzimwe, kana kuti Least Developed Countries mari inowanikwa nemunhu wega wega, hutera hwezvehupfumi, uye zvinonongedzera kusimukira kwevanhu zvakaita sehutano nechikafu chavanodya.

en: Of the 48 least developed countries in the world, 34 are in Africa.
sna: Panyika makumi mana nesere dzenyika dzisina kubudirira kudarika dzimwe dzese, nyika makumi matatu neina dziri muAfrica.

en: Three countries have graduated from their least developed status: Botswana, Cape Verde and Samoa.
sna: Nyika nhatu dzakayambuka kubva muchinzvimbo chekuva nyika dzisina kubudirira zvachose dzinoti: Botswana, Cape Verde neSamoa.

en: Strike Paralyzes Malawi's Judicial Services
sna: Kuramwa Basa Kwevashandi kunogarisa pasi mabasa ezvemutemo muMalawi

en: A week-long strike by the support staff of Malawi's judiciary system has paralyzed the courts, causing overcrowding in police cells and the indefinite suspension of major cases - including government corruption trials.
sna: Kuramwa basa kwesvondo rose nevashandi vanotsigira bazi rezvemutemo muMalawi kwagarisa pasi matare edzimhosva, zvakonzera kuzarisa kwemastokisi anochengeterwa vabatwa pamalamba emapurisa uye nekumiswa pasina anoziva kuti kusvikira rinhi kwekutongwa kwenyaya hombe,- kusanganisira kutongwa kwevashandi vehurumende munyaya dzehuori.

en: Court marshals, clerks and messengers are demanding the 30 percent salary increases promised by the government two years ago.
sna: Vanochengetedza hurongwa pamatare edzimhosva, vanyori nezvikonzi vari kuda kuwedzerwa kwemihoro yavo nezvikamu makumi matatu kubva muzana pamari yavari kutambira ikezvino sekuvumbisa kwehurumende makore maviri akadarika.

en: Chanting and singing around the court premises has become a pastime activity for the striking court workers since the onset of a sit-in last week.
sna: Kudanhidzira nekuimba pazvivanze zvematare edzimhosva ndizvo zvava kuvaraidza vashandi vari kuramwa mabasa ava kubva pakatanga chirongwa chekuuya kubasa asi vasingashande svondo rakapera.

en: Linley Hebert, a spokesperson for the striking workers, told VOA the strike is a result of the governments failure to honor a 2012 agreement.
sna: Linley Hebert, mutauriri wevashandi vari kuramwa mabasa ava, akaudza VOA kuti kuramwa mabasa uku kuri kubva pakukonewa kwehurumende kuzadzikisa zvayakawirorana nevashandi vayo muna 2012.

en: In October [this year], the government reviewed the salaries of the civil servants, but we were not included in that revision, Hebert said.
sna: Muna Gumiguru gore rino, hurumende yakasimudzira mihoro yevashandi vehurumende, asi isu hatina iswawo pakati pevakawedzerwa mihoro yavo, Hebert akadaro.

en: Yet in 2012, we had an agreement that each time they are revising the salaries of the civil servants, [they will be increasing our salaries as well].
sna: Asi muna 2012, takaita chibvumirano chekuti nguva yese pavawedzera mihoro yevashandi vehurumende, vanobva vawedzerawo neyedu mihoro.

en: So, [after adhering to the agreement in 2013], we are surprised to see that this time we are left out.
sna: Saka (mushure mekuzembera nekuremekedza chibvumirano chemuna 2013), tiri kushamiswa kuona kuti rwendo rwuno takabva tasiiwa tiri kunze.

en: Government authorities say the failure to increase judicial workers salaries this year is largely because of financial constraints, following a donor aid freeze against Malawi's government.
sna: Vakuru vehurumende vanoti kukonewa kuwedzera mari dzemihoro dvevashandi vemubazi rezvemutemo gore rino zvakanyanyokonzerwa nekuoma pane zvemari, mushure mekumiswa kwemari yaibva kumasangano anobatsira ichipihwa hurumende yeMalawi.

en: The freeze is a result of a government financial scandal in which more than $30 million was looted from government coffers.
sna: Kumiswa kwekuwedzerwa kwemari uku kuri kubva pahuori hwezvemari umo mari inodarika mamiriyoni makumi matatu yakamoorwa kubva muhomwe dzehurumende

en: Ministry of Finance spokesperson Nations Msowoya told a local radio station it is hard for the government to meet the workers' demand.
sna: Mutariri webazi rezvehupfumi, Nations Msowoya akaudza nhepfenyuro yemunharaunda kuti zvakaomera hurumede kuti izadzikise zviri kudiwa nevashandi vayo.

en: It is difficult to promise what the treasury will do.
sna: Zvakaoma kuvimbisa kuti vabati vechikwama chehurumende vachaita chii.

en: But suffice to say that the prevailing economic circumstances and budgetary constraints will make a little bit difficult for the treasury to bow down to the demands, "Msowoya said.
sna: Asi regai ndingoti mamiriro ezvehupfumi nekusomeka kwemari yekushandisa yehurumende zvichaita kuti  zviite sekugozhera vabati vechikwama chehurumende kuti vaite zviri kudiwa nevashandi, "Msowoya akadaro.

en: But according to Hebert, the strikers will not resume work until their demands are met.
sna: Asi nemaonero aHebert, vashandi ava havasi kuzodzokera kubasa kusvikira zvavari kuda zvadzikiswa.

en: "Since I was born [there has been] no time the government said it had some money.
sna: "Kubva zvandakazvarwa hapana nguva yekuti hurumende yaiti ine mari".

en: It has its own means [of finding the money] and it will find the same means to give us the money," Hebert insisted.
sna: Ine nzira yayo (yekuwana mari iyi) uye ichawana nzira yekutipa mari iyi, Herbert akasimbirira kudaro.

en: The ongoing strike is hampering progress of trials, as court operations remain suspended.
sna: Kuramwa mabasa kuri kuenderera mberi uku kuri kukanganisa kufambira mberi kwekutongwa kwenyaya, sezvo mabasa ematare edzimhosva akambomiswa kushanda.

en: Several trials, including that of former justice minister Ralph Kasambara, who is answering charges in connection with the financial scandal, were indefinitely suspended last week.
sna: Kutongwa kwakawanda kwevanhu, kusanganisira kweuya akambove gurukota rezvemutemo, Ralph Kasambara, ari kupomerwa mhosva yekuva chikamu chehuori hwemari yakabiwa, kwakamiswa svondo rakapera pasina anoziva kuti kusvikira rinhi.

en: Police are complaining of congestion in jail cells, as no suspects are being taken to court.
sna: Mapurisa ari kugunun'una kuti mastokisi mavanochengetra vanhu vari kunenedzerwa mhosva vasati vaenda kunotongwa makazarisa nekuti hapana vanhu vari kuendeswa kumatare.

en: Malawi police spokesperson Rhoda Manjolo told VOA the only option they have is "giving police bail to those with minor offenses."
sna: Mutauriri wemapurisa emuMalawi Rhoda Manjolo akaudza VOA imwe nzira yavasara nayo "ndeyekuti vanhu vae mhosva diki vatongwe vachibva kudzimba dzavo."

en: Human rights campaigners and legal experts say the strike is contributing to human rights violations.
sna: Vanorwira nekukurudzira kodzero dzevanhu nenyanzvi dzemutemo vanoti kuramwa mabasa uku kuri kuwedzera pakutyorwa kwemitemo yevanhu.

en: There are those people who have to be taken to court within 48 hours, noted Lawyer George Kadzipatike who works in a private practice in the northern city of Mzuzu.
sna: Kune vanhu vanofanirwa kuendeswa kunotongwa kumatare edzimhisva maawa makumi mana nemasere asati adarika, rakadaro gweta, George Kadzipatike, rinoshanda mukambani yemagweta muguta rekumaodzanyenba enyika rinonzi Mzuzu.

en: "We cannot make application for them to be granted bail.
sna: "Hatisi kugona kunyora tsamba tichivakumbirira kuti vatongwe vachibva kudzimba dzavo.

en: There are those people who do not want to live with their partners, they would like the court to decree that they be divorced, we cannot file any petition through the courts."
sna: Kune vaye vanhu vasisade kugara nevavakawanana navo, uye vari kuda kuti matare edzimhosva avati varambana zviri pamutemo, asi hatisi kugona kunyora chikumbiro chakadai kuburikidza nematare."

en: Government authorities say closed door negotiations to resolve the matter continue in the capital, Lilongwe.
sna: Vanhu vane zvigaro muhurumende vanoti nhaurirano dzemuchivande kuti nyaya iyi igadzirike dziri kuenderera mberi muguta guru, Lilongwe.

en: But the striking workers told VOA whatever the case, they will accept nothing short of a 30 percent increase in their salaries.
sna: Asi vashandi vari kuramwa mabasa vakaudza VOA kuti kunyangwe zvikaendepi, havasi kuzogamuchira kuwedzerwa kwemihoro yavo kuri pasi pezvikamu makumi matatu kubva muzana.

en: A similar strike lasted three months in 2012 after the magistrates and judges joined the labor action.
sna: Kuramwa mabasa kwakafanana nekuku kwaita mwedzi mitatu muna2012 mushure mekunge vatongi vematare epasi neepamusoro vose vapindawo mukuramwa mabasa uku.

en: Famine in Southern Africa Worse Than Predicted - 2002-07-39
sna: Zhara kuchamhembe kweAfrica Yakashatisisa Kudarika Zvakange Zvichitarisirwa

en: The United Nations World Food Program says the famine in southern Africa is even worse than predicted.
sna: Bandiko remubatanidzwa wenyika dzepasi rose rinoona nezvekuwanikwa kwekudya kuvanhu vari mumatambudziko reUnited Nations World Food Program, kana kuti WFP, rinoti zhara kuchamhembe kweAfrica yakanyanya kuipa kudarika zvakange zvichitarisirwa.

en: WFP officials are warning that 13 million people in six countries: Malawi, Zambia, Lesotho, Zimbabwe, Swaziland and Mozambique are in danger of starvation if they do not get food aid.
sna: Vakuru veWFP vari kuyambira kuti vanhu vanosvika mamiriyoni gumi nematatu munyika nhanhatu dzinoti: Malawi, Zambia, Lesotho, Zimbabwe, Swaziland neMozambique vari munjodzi yekufa nezhara kana vakasabatsirwa nezvekudya.

en: World Food Program officials say they need one million tons of food to alleviate hunger in southern Africa, but they are not confident they will get it.
sna: Vakuru veWorld Food Program vanoti vanoda chikafu chinoyera matani miriyoni rimwe chete  kuti chirerutse zhara kuchamhembe kweAfrica, asi havana chokwadi kuti vachachiwana chikafu ichi.

en: In an appeal to the international community at the beginning of July, WFP officials asked for more than $0.5 billion to buy food.
sna: Muchikumbiro kunyika dzepasi rose chakaitwa muutanga kwaChikunguru, vakuru veWFP vakakumbira mari ingasvike mazana mazana mashanu emamiriyoni emadhora ekutenga chikafu.

en: So far they have received only 20 percent of that.
sna: Pari zvino vakwanisa kuwana zvikamu makumi maviri kubva muzana kwemari iyi. Mukuru weWFP kuchemhembe kweAfrica, Judith Lewis, anoti mamiriro ezvinhu asvika kumawere chaiko pekuti voshaiwa zano.

en: WFP's director for the southern Africa region, Judith Lewis, says the situation is getting desperate.
sna: Mukuru weWFP kuchemhembe kweAfrica, Judith Lewis, anoti mamiriro ezvinhu asvika kumawere chaiko pekuti voshaiwa zano.

en: "The window of opportunity to avert what could be a major humanitarian crisis is closing," she said.
sna: "Mukana wekuti tinzvenge nyatwa muvanhu wavakuvharika," akadaro.

en: "We need more assistance now.
sna: "Tinoda rubetsero rwakawanda ikezvino.

en: We need food on the high seas now, or we need cash to buy commodities that are still available in southern Africa, so we can avert this major, major crisis."
sna: Tinoda kui chikafu chinge chava muzvikepe munyanza chichiuya kuno, kana kuti tinoda mari yekutenga zvinodiwa zvichiri kuwanikwa kuchamhembe kweAfrica, kuti tinzvenge ruhavashava rwukuru urwu."

en: Currently, the WFP is assisting six million of the most vulnerable people in the six most severely affected countries.
sna: Pari zvino, the WFP iri kubatsira mamiriyoni matanhatu evanhu vari panjodzi yakaipisisa munyika nhanhatu dzakanyanya kubatwa nedambudziko rezhara iri.

en: About half of these people are in Zimbabwe.
sna: Chikamu chiri pakati nepakati chevanhu ava vari muZimbabwe.

en: The agency says it is sure the number of people needing its help will rise.
sna: Bandiko iri rinoti rine idi yekuti kuwandu hwevanhu vachada ruyamuro rwuchawedzera.

en: The World Health Organization notes southern Africa, in addition to having the highest prevalence of HIV/AIDS in the world, also has the world's highest chronic malnutrition rates.
sna: Sangano rezvehutano pasi pose reWorld Health Organization rinoti dunhu rekuchamhembe kweAfrica, pamusoro pekuva nehuwandu hwekupararira kwedende reshuramatongo pasi rose, ndirowo rine huwandu hwakakurisisa pasi rose rwevanhu vanorwara nekusadya kudya kunovaka muviri.

en: It predicts about 300,000 people could die over the next six months from diseases related to malnutrition.
sna: Sangano iri rinotarisira kuti vanhu vangasvike zviuru mazana matatu vangangofa mumwedzi mitanhatu inotevera nekudakwezvirwere zvine chekuita nekushaiwa kudya kwakanaka kunovaka muviri.

en: Ms. Lewis says the dying has already begun.
sna: Muzvare Lewis vanoto kwatotanga kufiwa.

en: "We are seeing people moving from their villages," she said.
sna: "Tiri kuona vanhu vachibva kumisha yavo," akadaro.

en: "If they know there is going to be a food distribution, they immediately go there.
sna: "Kana vakaziva kuti pachazove nekugoverwa kwechikafu, vanobva vatoenda ikoko pasina kupedza nguva.

en: The problem is we do not even have enough food to feed the people who are on the rolls, let alone add food for other people in the areas. Is there a potential to become chaotic? Yes. "
sna: Dambudziko nderekuti hatitorina chikafu chinoringana kuvanhu vakanyorwa pasi kuti vapihwe chikafu ichi, tisingataure nezvevamwe vanhu vari mune dzimwe nzvimbo. Pangaite mukana wekuti panopedzesera pava nemhirizhonga here? Hongu. "

en: WFP'S Judith Lewis says at this time of year the agency is usually planning how to get food supplies into the region before the rainy season hits in October.
sna: Judith Lewis weWFP anoti panguva ino yegore bandiko iri rinenge richironga kuti rinowana sei chikafu chinopinda mudunhu iri mvura isati yaturuka muzhizha munaGumiguru.

en: But she says since the WFP is already having difficulty meeting its present targets, it can't even begin to plan for future food deliveries.
sna: Asi vanoti sezvo WFP yatova nedambudziko kuzadzikisa zviga zvayo zvaitori nazvo, hangakwanise kuchitanga kurongera kuunzwa kwechikafu chichazoda kushandiswa kumberi uko.

en: Canadian PM Impressed With African Development Plan
sna: Mutungamiriri weCanada Anofadzwa nehurongwa hwebudiriro hwemuAfrica

en: Canadian Prime Minister Jean Chretien says he is impressed with the progress being made towards implementing an African development plan.
sna: Mutungamiriri weCanada, Jean Chretien anoti ari kufadzwa nekufambira mberi kuri kuita basa rekumisa hurongwa hwekubudirira kweAfrica.

en: Mr. Chretien made the remarks Sunday after meeting with South African President Thabo Mbeki and other regional leaders in Pretoria.
sna: Chretien akataura mashoko aya neSvondo mushure mekusangana nemutungamiriri weSouth Africa vaThabo Mbeki vevamwe vatungamiriri vedunhu reAfrica iri muPretoria.

en: Mr. Chretien, the current chairman of the group of the seven most industrialized nations plus Russia, is visiting Africa to discuss the New Partnership for Africa's Development, known as NEPAD.
sna: Chretien, anova sachigaro wechikwata chenyika nomwe dzakabudirira kudarika dzimwe, kuchiwedzerwa Russia, ari kushanyira Africa kuti aite nhaurirano pamuso pe Kushandirapamwe Kutsva Kuitira Kubudirira KweAfrica kana kuti New Partnership for Africa's Development, inowanzozivikanwa sekuti NEPAD.

en: He said NEPAD will be one of the top agendas at the June G-8 summit in Kananaskis, Canada.
sna: Akati NEPAD ichange iri imwe yamadonzvo epamusoro soro pamusangano wenyika dzakabudirira kudarika dzimwe unonzi G-8 ku Kananaskis, Canada, muna Chivabvu.

en: The G-8 nations are Britain, Canada, France, Germany, Italy, Japan, the United States and Russia.
sna: Nyika dziri muG-8 dzinoti Britain, Canada, France, Germany, Italy, Japan, the United States neRussia.

en: Mr. Chretien says topics such as human rights, democracy the rule of law, transparency and good governance will be discussed at the G8 summit.
sna: Chretien anoti misoro yenyaya dzakaita kodzero dzevanhu, gutsaruzhinji, simba remutemo pakugadzirisa nyaya munyika, kujeka zvisina kuvanza nehunjari njari uyewo nekutonga kwakanaka zvichataurwa nezvazvo pamusangano mukuru uyu weG8.

en: NEPAD outlines objectives of promoting democracy and good governance in Africa in return for Western economic assistance.
sna: NEPAD inojekesa zviga zvekukurudzira gutsaruzhinji nekutonga kwakanaka muAfrica kuti iwane rubatsiro rwezvehupfumi kubva kunyika dzekumavirira.

en: It seeks to achieve an annual growth rate of seven-percent on the African continent by 2015.
sna: Ine chinangwa chekuwanakukura pagore kwezvikamu zvinomwe kubva muzana munyika dzose dzemuAfrica panosvika gore ra2015.

en: South African President Mbeki said he is convinced that Africa is ready for NEPAD saying there has been definite progress toward democracy in the continent.
sna: Mutungamiriri weSouth Africa vaMbeki vakapwiswa kuti Africa yagadzira NEPAD vachitiwo panga paine kufambira mberi panyaya yegutsaruzhinji muAfrica.

en: Later, Mr. Chretien and Mr. Mbeki were joined by presidents Festus Mogae of Botswana, Bakili Muluzu of Malawi, Joaquim Chissano of Mozambique, Sam Nujoma of Namibia, Benjamin Makapa of Tanzania and Vice President Enoch Kavindele of Zambia.
sna: Mushure mezvizvi, Chretien navaMbeki vakazobatanawo nevatungamiriri Festus Mogae vekuBotswana, Bakili Muluzu veMalawi, Joaquim Chissano vekuMozambique, Sam Nujoma vekuNamibia, Benjamin Makapa vekuTanzania nemutevedzeri wemutungamiriri weZambia Enoch Kavindele.

en: Zimbabwe's President Robert Mugabe, who won re-election in disputed voting last month, was not invited.
sna: Mutungamiriri weZimbabwe vaRobert Mugabe, avo vakakunda pasarudzo dzakaitwa kepiri mwedzi wadkadarika asi zviri kurambwa nemapato anokwikwidza, havana kukokwa.

en: Reuters news agency reports the Canadian prime minister who has already visited Morocco, Algeria and Nigeria on his six-nation tour will visit Ethiopia and Senegal after South Africa.
sna: Sangano frenhau reReuters rinonyora nhau pamusoro pemutungamiriri weCanada uyo atoshanyira Morocco, Algeria neNigeria parwendo rwake kunyika nhanhatu, achashanyirawo Ethiopia  neSenegal mushure meSouth Africa.

en: Some information for this report provided by Reuters and AFP.
sna: Zvimwe zvinyorwa munhau idzi zvakapihwa neReuters neAFP.

en: Child Labor in Malawi
sna: Kushandiswa Kwevana Mukuita Mabasa Evanhu Vakuru MuMalawi

en: The organization, Eye of the Child, is expressing concern about what is says is a large number of children who are being forced to work due to poverty.
sna: Sangano rinonzi Ziso Remwana kana kuti, Eye of the Child, riri kuratidza kushushikana pamusoro pezvarinoti vana vakawanda vari kumanikidzwa kushanda nekuda kwehurombo.

en: It says these children risk being abused.
sna: Inoti vana ava vari munjodzi yekubatwa zvisina kunaka nekukanganiswa nevanhu vakuru.

en: Some under aged children work as mini bus call boys in the busy business district of Limbe in the commercial capital, Blantyre.
sna: Vamwe vana vane mazera madoko chose vanoshanda vachisheedzera kuti vanhu vakwire michovha mudunhu rinoitwa zvemabhizimisi ekutenga nekutengesa reLimbe muguta guru muMalawi munezvekutenga nekutengesa, Blantyre.

en: They are some of the many children who have been forced into employment because of poverty.
sna: Ava ndivo vamwe vevana varikusundwa nekumanikidzwa kutsvaga mabasa nekuda kwehurombo.

en: Maxwell Matewere is the executive director of Eye of the Child.
sna: Maxwell Matewere ndiye mukuru anofambisa basa reEye of the Child.

en: He says many of the children come from rural areas.
sna: Anoti vana vazhinji vanobva kumaruwa

en: He says, "Currently we havent done a data analysis but the Ministry of Labor intends to do that as soon as possible with financial resources from the International Labor Organization.
sna: Anoti, "Ikezvino hatisati taita ongoro yekuona hwuwandu asi bazi rinoona nezvemabasa rine hurongwa hwekuita izvi nekukasira richibatsirwa nemari kubva kuInternational Labor Organization.

en: But basing on our own assessment and through our works, we feel child labor is a serious problem particularly in the rural areas and you can tell that from trafficking of children from rural areas to urban areas where most of the young people are working in peoples houses.
sna: Asi tichishandisa ongororo yedu uye kuburikidza nemabasa edu, tinofunga kuti kushanda kwevana vachiita mabasa evanhu vakuru idambudziko guru chose zvikuru sei kumaruwa, uye unogona kuzviona nekufambiswa kwevana zviri kunze kwemutemo kubva kumaruwa vachiendeswa kumaguta uko vazhinji vevana ava vari kushanda mudzimba dzevanhu.

en: Mr. Matewere says poor children often find work on large farm estates.
sna: VaMatewere vanoti vana varombo vanowanzowana basa pamapurazi makuru.

en: He said, We have noticed that there are some indications that there are children who are working in tea estates and tobacco estates.
sna: Takaonawo zvinoratidzo kuti kune vana vari kushanda mumapurazi makuru etii neefodya.

en: There also are children who are working in brick making mostly their parents will facilitate for them to work in those kinds of employment. "
sna: Kune vana zvakare vari kushanda mukuforoma zvidhinha, uye kazhinji vabereki vavo ndivo vanoronga kuti vapinde mumabasa akadai. "

en: Mr. Matewere says the Eye of the Child has established that there are gross violations of children rights in the country.
sna: VaMatewere vanoti the Eye of the Child yava nehumboo hwekuti pane kutyorwa kukuru kwekodzero dzevana munyika,

en: These include, rape, defilement and being overworked.
sna: Izvi zvinosanganisira kubatwa chibharo, kubatwa nekushandiswa kwemiviri yavo zvisina kunaka nekushandiswa zvisina mwero.

en: He says this violates the United Nations Convention on the Rights of the Child.
sna: Vanoti izvi zvinotyora zvisungo zvemubatanidzwa wenyika dzose pamusoro pekodzero dzevana, kana kuti United Nations Convention on the Rights of the Child.

en: If you look at the Convention of the Rights of a Child, he said, "you will see that it provides for the protection for children from any kind of exploitation from any kind of harmful activities or act which threatens their health, their development which is a threat to education.
sna: Vakati kana ukatarisa Convention of the Rights of a Child, "uchaona kuti inopa kuchengetedzwa kwevana kubva pakushandiswa kusina kunaka muzvinhu zvese nemabasa ose anokuvadza kana kukanganisa hutano hwavo kana kukura kwavo kwakanaka izviwo zvichizokanganisa kugona kwavo kudzidza.

en: So children who are found working in tea estates, who are found in brick making, obvious, their rights as it is provided for in the Convention for the Rights of the Children as well as in the constitution are violated. "
sna: Saka vana vari kuwanikwa vachishanda mumapurazi makuru anorima tii, vanowanikwa vachiforoma zvidhinha, zviri pachena kuti kodzero dzavo zvezvadzakatarwa muConvention for the Rights of the Children uyewo nemubumbiro remutemo dziri kutyorwa. "

en: The Eye of the Child executive director says his organization is looking at ways of protecting the rights of a child.
sna: Mukuru anoona nezvekufambiswa kwebasa pa The Eye of the Child anoti sangano ravo riri kutarisa nzira dzekuchengetedza kodzero dzemwana.

en: He says to achieve this, the group has started a number of programs.
sna: Vanoti kuti izvi zvogoneke, chikwata chavo chakatotanga kuita zvirongwa zvakati kuti.

en: "We have recently started a new program and what we are trying to do is to inform the general public on the best interests of the child and to inform them on the rights of a child.
sna: "Tichangotanga chirongwa chitsva uye zvatiri kuedza kuita kuudza veruzhinji nezvezvinhu zvanoita kuti hupenyu hwevana huenderere mberi zvakanaka uye nekuvaudza nezvekodzero dzevana.

en: At the same we want also to build up the capacity of the children themselves so that may be they can be use their authentic voice out their concerns. "
sna: Panguva imwe chete tiri kudawo kuvaka goneso yevana pachezvavo kuti zvichida vanogona kushandisa izwi ravo rinorevesa kuti vataure pachena zvinhu zvinovashungurudza nekuvanetsa."

en: According to the Ministry of Labor authorities, many children are forced to leave school and find work because parents cannot afford school fees.
sna: Sekutaurwa kwazvakaitwa nevakuru mubandiko rehurumende chinoona nezvemabasa, vana vazhinji vanomakidzwa kusiya chokoro votsvaga basa nekuti vabereki vavo havakwanise kuvabhadharira mari kuti vaende kuchikoro.

en: Although primary school is free in Malawi, most children do not attend due to lack of necessities like clothes.
sna: Kunyangwe hazvo kudzidza kuzvidanho zvekutanga muzvikoro zvemuMalawi kuri kwemahara, vana vazhinji havaende nekuti vanenge vachishaiwa zvimwewo zvinhu zvinodikanwa muhupenyu, zvakaita senhumbi.

en: Over 60 per cent of Malawis nearly 11 million people live below the poverty line.
sna: Chikamu chinodarika makumi matanhatu kubva muzana chemamiriyoni angasvike gumi nerimwe evanhu vemuMalawi vanorarama muhurombo huri pasi pechiyero chinoita kuti vanhu vangopona zvezuva nezuva.

en: Malawi Court Convicts 12 People in Albino Attack
sna: Dare Remhosva RemuMalawi Rinowana Vanhu Gumi Nemumwe Vine Mhosva Yekukuuraya Vasope

en: A high court in Malawi has convicted five people of murder for the 2018 killing of a 22-year-old albino man, including the victims brother.
sna: Dare guru remuMalawi rakawana vanhu vashanu, kusanganisira mukoma wemushakabvu, vaine mhosva yakaitwa muna2018 yekuponda murume musope wemakore makumi maviri nemaviri.

en: The court convicted seven other people of selling the victim's body parts.
sna: Dare iri rakawana vamwe vanhu vanomwe vaine mhosva yekutengesa mitezo yemurume musope akapondwa uyu.

en: Malawi officials say more than 170 albinos have been attacked in the country since 2014 by people who believe their body parts bring luck and wealth.
sna: Vakuru vemuMalawi vanoti vasope vanodarika zana nemakumi manomwe vakapondwa munyika kubva muna 2014 nevanhu vanofunga kuti mitezo yavo inounza rombo rakanaka nehupfumi.

en: Family members of the deceased, MacDonald Masambuka, left the courtroom Thursday with hopes of justice being served after the court convicted all 12 people accused in his death.
sna: Hama dzemushakabvu, MacDonald Masambuka, dzakabuda muimba yekutongwa yedare dziine tariro yekuti kutonga kwekururamisira kuchaitwa mushure mekunge dare rawana vanhu vose gumi nevaviri vari kupomerwa mhosva vaine mhosva yekumuponda.

en: amily members, including Masambukas mother, appeared calm and composed as Judge Dorothy NyaKaunda Kamanga read the judgments.
sna: Nhengo dzemhuri, dzaisanganisira amai vaMasambuka, vairatidza kudzikama apo mutongi Dorothy NyaKaunda Kamanga aiverenga mitongo yake.

en: Those convicted included a Catholic priest, Father Thomas Muhosa, police officer Chikondi Chileka, clinician Lumbani Kamanga, and the deceaseds brother, Cassim Masambuka.
sna: Vakawanikwa vaine mhosva vanosanganisira fata wechechi yeRoma, Father Thomas Muhosa, mupurisa Chikondi Chileka, mushandi wepachipatara Lumbani Kamanga, uye nemukoma wemushakabvu, Cassim Masambuka.

en: Charges included murder, extracting human tissues, causing harm to a person with disability, and trafficking in persons.
sna: Mhosva dzavo dzaisanganisira kuponda, kubvisa mitezo kubva pamuviri wemunhu kuunza kukuvadza kumuviri wemunhu anorarama nehurema nekuba nekufambisa vanhu zviri kunze kwemutemo.

en: Kamanga convicted the victims brother and four others of murder.
sna: Kamanga akawana mukoma wemushakabvu nevamwe vana vaine mhosva yekumuponda.

en: The court convicted seven other people, including the priest and police officer, of selling the victim's body parts.
sna: Dare rakawana vamwe vanomwe, kusanganisira fata nemupurisa, vaine mhosva yekutengesa mitezo yemushakabvu.

en: Business with tissue  According to the court, Muhosha, Chileka and others offered to conduct business using human tissue extracted from a human corpse.
sna: Kuita mari nekutengesa mitezo. Maringe nezvakataurwa nedare, Muhosha, Chileka nevamwe vakati vaigona kuita mhindu vachishandisa mitezo yakabviswa pachitunha chemunhu.

en: The judge said the state proved beyond reasonable doubt the 12 people conspired to kill Masambuka to extract his bones based on a perception they would benefit financially.
sna: Mutongi akati vachuchuti vakaratidza humboo husina kupokana kuti vanhu gumi nevaviri ava vakarangana kuuraya Masambuka nekuzobvisa mapfupa ake kubva pamuviri wake vachifungidzira kuti vaizobatsirikana nekuwana mari.

en: She said Masambuka is the latest victim of violent attacks on persons with albinism who have not been protected by the community.
sna: Akati Masambuka ndiye munhu achangobva mukupondwa kuburikidza nekukuvadzwa zvakaipisisa kwevanhu vanorarama nehusope vanga vasiri kuchengetedzwa nekurwirwa nevanhu vagere munharaunda.

en: Director of Public Prosecutions Steve Kayuni represented the state in the case.
sna: Mukuru wevachuchuti Steve Kayuni ndiye akange akamiririra hurumende  mumhosva iyi.

en: He said he was pleased the court agreed on all the seven charges he presented.
sna: Akati akafadzwa kuti dare rakatenderana naye pamhosva dzose dzaakatura kudare achiti ndidzo dzakange dzaparwa.

en: Its really something overwhelming on the part of the state considering that this matter, if you notice, there is a police officer involved, a priest involved and there is a brother involved.
sna: Chinhu chinobitirira kurutivi rwehurumende kuti kana ukazvitarisisa kuti munyayaya iyi muna fata arimo, mune muprisa arimowo uye muene mukoma wemushakabvu ari mukati mayo zvakare.

en: If you notice, it all revolves around the position of trust that somebody like the late Macdonald Masambuka trusted so much, they are the ones who ended up betraying him, Kayuni said.
sna: Ukatarisisa, inotenderera pachinzvimbo chekuvimbwa zvekuti munhu akaita samushakabvu Macdonald Masambuka aivimba nevanhu ava zvekuti, ndivo vakazopedzesera vomurasisa nekumutengesa, Kayuni akadaro.

en: Masambuka went missing from his village on March 9, 2018, and his limbless body was found buried in a garden on April 2, 2018, in his home district of Machinga south of Malawi.
sna: Masambuka akatanga kushaikwa kubva mumusha wake musi wa 9 Kurume, 2018, uye muviri wake wakange usisina maoko nemakumbo wakazowanikwa wakavigwa mubindu musi wa 2 Kubvumbi, 2018, mudunhu raaigara reMachinga kuchamhembe kweMalawi.

en: Enticement  Court documents show that Masambuka was enticed by his brother to meet his friends, who he claimed had found a girl for him to marry.
sna: Kurunzirwa Mapepa emudare redzimhosva anoratidza kuti Masambuka akarunzirwa nemukoma wake kuti asangane neshamwari dzake, vaiti vakange vamuwanira musikana wekuti aroore.

en: But when they reached the scene, the alleged friends grabbed Masambuka by the neck and dragged him to a garden where they killed him.
sna: Asi pavasvika panzvimbo yakazoparwa mhosva, dziya dzainzi ishamwari dzakabva dzabata nechisimba Masambuka nepamutsipa, ndokumuzvuvira kubindu uko vakasvikomuurayira.

en: Here, his assailants cut off his limbs, burned his body using petrol and buried it there.
sna: Ipapo, vapondi vake vakacheka maoko nemakumbo ake, ndokupisa muviri wake vachishandisa mafuta epeturu ndokumuviga ipapo.

en: This was the first such case involving high-profile community members involved in attacks on persons with albinism.
sna: Iyi ndiyo nyaya yekutanga ine vanhu vanozivikanwa zvikuru munharaunda vachiwanikwa vari mukati mekuponda vanhu vanorarama nehusope.

en: Masauko Chamkakala, the lawyer for the 12 defendants in the case, said he would comment once he had gone through the judgment.
sna: Masauko Chamkakala, gweta revapomerwi gumi nevaviri ava munyaya iyi rakati raizowana zvekutaura pamusoro penyaya iyi kana awana nguva yekurava mutongo uyu.

en: We are still waiting to see the perfected judgment so that we can read it and study it and talk to our clients, Chamkakala said.
sna: Tichakamirira kuti tione chinyorwa chekutongwa chapepetwa kuti tichiverenge nekuchinzvera, tozotaura nevanhu vatanga tichimiririra munyaya iyi, Chamkakala akadaro.

en: Rights activists said they expected the court to give stiffer punishment to those convicted.
sna: Vanhu vanorwira kodzero vakati vaitarisira dare kuti ripe mutongo unorwadza chose kuna avo vese vakawanikwa vaine mhosva.

en: Serious sentencing'
sna: Mutongo usina jee'

en: Ian Simbota represented the Association of Persons with Albinism at the court.
sna: Ian Simbota wakange akamirira musangano wevanhu vanorarama nehusope cheAssociation of Persons with Albinism padare.

en: When the judge was reading, what concerned me was that part of a [Priest] Father Muhosha [and others] who have been convicted of transacting body parts.
sna: Mutongi paanga achiverenga, chandibata chikamu chiya apo fata weRoma, Father Muhosha nevamwe vawanikwa vaine mhosva yekutengesa mitezo yemuviri wemunhu.

en: If you go to the Anatomy Act, it is not so hard on such offenses.
sna: Kana ukanorava mutemo pamusoro pemitezo yemumuviri wemunhu, Anatomy Act, hazvina kuoma kuti uone nekunzwisisa kutyorwa kwemutemo pakadai.

en: So, we are really looking forward to the judge, if at all its possible, to put a human face to the case so that at least we really need to see serious sentencing on this case, Simbota said.
sna: Saka takanyatsomirira kuti tione kuti mutongi, kana zvichigoneka, kuti aone nyaya iyi sekubata nekurwadza kwairi kuita vanhu, nekuti tinofanirwa kuti tione mutongo unorema usina jee panyaya iyi, akadaro, Simbota.

en: The high court is expected to sentence the perpetrators on May 30.
sna: Dare repamusoro riri kutarisirwa kutura mutongo waro pamhondi idzi musi wa 30 Chivabvu.

en: In another case, a high court on Thursday sentenced a 37-year-old man to life in prison for the 2020 murder of a 14-year-old-boy with albinism in Phalombe district.
sna: Mune imwe nyaya, nemusi weChina, dare repamusoro rakatongera mumwe murume ane makore makumi matatu nemanomwe kugara muchitoro mukomana wemakore gumi nemana airarama nehusope mudunhu rePhalombe.

en: Zimbabwe Official Defends Crackdown on Protests, Urges Patience with Economy
sna: Mushandi mukuru muhurumende yeZimbabwe Anotsigira Kutsikirirwa Pasi Kwekuratidzira, Anokurudzira Moyo Murefu Pane Zvehupfumi.

en: Zimbabwe's minister of foreign affairs and international trade on Monday defended crackdowns on anti-government demonstrations and urged patience in turning around the country's foundering economy.
sna: Gurukota rinoona nezvekunze kweZimbabwe nekutengeserana nedzimwe nyika nemusi weMuvhuro vakatsigira kutsikirirwa pasi kwekuratidzira kwekushora hurumende rikakurudzira kuti paitwe moyo murefu mukuvandudza kwezvehupfumi hwenyika hwurikudzadzarika.

en: Though "everybody's got the right to demonstrate," there have "been a lot of insinuations and campaigns of violence," Sibusiso B. Moyo told VOA in an interview.
sna: Kunyangwe hazvo "munhu wese anekodzero yekuratidzira,"panga pavakuita zevezeve nekukurudzira mhirizhonga," Sibusiso B. Moyo vakaudza told VOA munhaurirano yekubvunzwa mibvunzo.

en: Citing public safety, he endorsed a Zimbabwe court's ruling hours earlier to uphold a police ban on a protest organized by the opposition Movement for Democratic Change (MDC) alliance.
sna: Achitaura nezvekuchengetedzwa kweveruzhinji, akadzigira mutongo wedare redzimhosva rwakasimbisa kumiswa nemapurisa kwekuratidzira kwakange kwarongwa nesangano rinopikisa reMovement for Democratic Change (MDC) alliance.

en: Alliance leaders are pressing President Emmerson Mnangagwa and the ruling ZANU-PF party for a role in a transitional government.
sna: Vatungamiriri veAlliance vari kusunda mutungamiriri wenyika vaEmmerson Mnangagwa nebato rir kutonga reZANU-PF kuti ikwanewo muhurumende ichambobata matomu ichiyambutsa nyika kubva pairi kusvikira zvinhu zvadzikama.

en: They had organized a demonstration Monday in Bulawayo, the country's second-largest city, but police authorities banned it hours before its intended start.
sna: Vakange varonga kuratidzira musi weMuvhuro muBulawayo, guta rechipiri pakukura munyika, asi vakuru vemapurisa vakakudzivisa kwasara maawa mashoma kuti kutange.

en: Two other opposition demonstrations still are planned this week: for the central city of Gweru on Tuesday and the southeastern city of Masvingo on Wednesday.
sna: Kumwe kuratidzira kuviri kuchakaronga svondo rino: kweguta riri pakati oenyika reGweru neChipiri uye nekweguta riri kuchamhembe kwakadziva kumabvazuva enyika reMasvingo neChitatu.

en: Police also had pre-emptively banned a demonstration in Harare last Friday, a decision upheld by a Zimbabwe court.
sna: Mapurisa akange atofanodzivisa kuratidzira uku, chinhu chakazotsigirwawo nedare redzimhosva remuZimbabwe.

en: Hundreds of MDC supporters ignored the ban, leading to clashes between civilians and police.
sna: Mazana evatsigiri veMDC vakashaiwa hanya nekudziviswa uku, zvakazoita kuti pave nekudhumana pakati pevagari nemapurisa.

en: Video and photographs showed police hitting and kicking some demonstrators among actions that drew complaints of excessive force from civil and human rights groups, including the United Nations human rights office.
sna: Mifananidzo yezvivhitivhiti nemufananidzo nje yairatidza mapurisa achirova nekukava vamwe varatidziri pakati pezvimwe zvavayiita izvo zvakaita kuti pave nekugunun'una kubva kumapoka anomiririra vagari neanorwira kodzero dzevanhu kusanganisira hofisi yezvekodzero dzevanhu yeUnited Nations kwekuti mapurisa akashandisa simba rakawandisisa pakuedza kudzivisa vairatidzira.

en: Police, not demonstrators, showed up in force on Bulawayo streets Monday, with foot patrols wielding shields, batons and, in some cases, pistols.
sna: Mapurisa, kwete vanhu vairatidzira, ndivo vakauya vakapakatira zvombo mumigwagwa yemuBulawayo neMuvhuro, vaine napurisa ayifamba netsoka vaine zvinhu zvekuzvichengetedza kana vakatemwa nematombo nezvimwe, uye vaine tsvimbo zvakare vamwe vavo vaine zvivhorovhoro.

en: The Associated Press reported police trucks and water cannons positioned in the downtown area.
sna: Sangano renhau reAssociated Press rakatura nhau dzekuti motokari huru dzemapurisa nedzimwe dzinomwaya mvura inovava dzakange dzakamiswa munzvimbo dzemuguta dzinofamba nekutengwa neveruzhinji.

en: A young man in Bulawayo, identifying himself only as James, told VOA that negotiations between the government and opposition leaders were even more important than demonstrations.
sna: Mumwe murume wechidiki wemuBulawayo, akazviti anongonzi James, akaudza VOA kuti kutaurirana nekuwirirana pakati pehurumende nevakuru vemapato anokwikwidza dzakange dzakakosha kudarika kuratidzira uku.

en: Honestly, to demonstrate, we can end up being hurt by being beaten, being chased around.
sna: Kutaura chokwadi, kana tikaratidzira, tinogona kupedzisira takuvadzwa nekurohwa, nekudzingirirwa.

en: There's really nothing that we see coming out of it, James said.
sna: Hapana chisvinu chatinoona chichibuda pazviri, James akadaro.

en: "But these men should sit down and see what they can do for us, especially us, the youth. We have been affected a lot, and we are getting old just running."
sna: "Asi varume ava vanofanirwa kugara pasi voona kuti chii chaizvo chavanogona kutiitira, zvikuru sei isu, vechidiki. Takakanganiswa zvakanyanya, uye tavakutochembera tichingomhanya."

en: Moyo, the foreign minister, told VOA the administration is "undertaking economic reforms [that] are fundamental and they are key to ensuring that even the youth would finally have jobs created for them, so that we can create an environment where investors and the capital will find it easy to come into this country, where jobs will be created, and the youth will be part and parcel of economic activity."
sna: Moyo, gurukota rezvekunze, akaudza VOA kuti hurumende iri "kurongedza nekugadzirisa shanduko pane zvehupfumi zvinova hwaro nenheyo uye zviri tsvongonoro dzekuona kuti kunyangwe vechidiki vanozopedzeserawo vawana mabasa avanenge vagadzirirwa, kuitira kuti tigadzire mamiriro ezvinhu ekuti vanoda kuita mabhizimisi munyika uye nemari dzacho vanozviwana zviri nyore muuya munyika, mabasa ozogadzirwa, uyewo vechidiki vovawo chikamu nechidimbu chezvinenge zvichiitika mune zvehupfumi."

en: Moyo said Zimbabwe is midway into a two-year "transition stabilization program" to revive the country's devastated economy: "We have got one year to go and we are saying we should by then be out of the doldrums."
sna: Moyo akati Zimbabwe vava pakati nepakati pagwendo gwemakore maviri "gwehurongwa gwekudzikamisa zvingu panguva yekuyambuka kubva mune zvazuro" gwekumutsiridza zvehupfumi hwenyika zvakashakadzwa: "Tasara negore rimwe kuti tipedze gwendo gwedu, uye titi kuti panhambo idzodzo tinenenge tabuda mumatope ati maari aya."

en: The southern African country of nearly 16 million is experiencing its worst financial crisis since 2008, beset by hyperinflation and the fallout of decades of corruption.
sna: Nyika iyi iri kuchamhembe kweAfrica iine vanhu vangapotse vasvike ,amiriyoni gumi nematanhatu iri mudope rakaipisisa mune zvemari zvisati zvamboitika kubva gore ra2008, zvakonzerwa nekukwira kwemitengo kuri kukonzerwa nekudonha kwehukoshi hwemari yemunyika nekusakadzwa kwakakonzerwa nemakore nemakore ehuvori munyika.

en: Many struggle to buy basics such as food and medicine.
sna: Vanhu vakawanda vanotambura kutenga zvinhu zvinodiwa zuva nezuva, zvakaita semishonga nezvekudya.

en: With the poor economy and crops devastated by drought and a spring cyclone, the UN World Food Program anticipates that 5.5 million people will need emergency food aid by next April.
sna: Mukati mezvehupfumi hwakaromboka, zvirimwa zvakatsvaigwa nekushaikwa kwemvura vuye nemadutuemvura yakawandisa, bazi reUN reWorld Food Program rinotarisira kuti vanhu vanosvika mamiriyoni mashanu nezviuru mazana mashanu zvichada zvekudya nekukasira Kubvumbi wegore rinouya asati asvika.

en: Finance Minister Mthuli Ncube, who had predicted 3.1% growth for 2019, offered a sobering update to Zimbabwe's parliament in early August.
sna: Gurukota rezvemari,Mthuli Ncube, uyo akange atarisira kuti hupfumi hwaizokura nezvikamu zvitatu nechidimbu chimwe chete mugore ra2019, akazouya nezviri kunystoitika zvinochangamutsa kudare reparamende yeZimbabwe pakutanga kwaNyamavhuvhu.

en: "The revised 2019 GDP growth is expected to be negative," Reuters news service reported him as saying.
sna: "Ongororo itsva yezvichaitika muna2019 inoratidza kuti pachange pasina kukura kwezvirikuitika munezvehupfumi," Sangano renhau reReuters rakanyora nhau dzaro richiti ndizvo zvaakange ataura.

en: Ncube did not provide any updated figure.
sna: Ncube haana kupa humwe humboo hunoratidza kuwanda kana kudzikira pane zvehupfumi.

en: Civil Society Workers Run Afoul of Tanzania Security Officials in Sign of Increasing Clampdown
sna: Vashandi Vemasangano Anorwira Kodzero Dzevanhu Vanonetswa Nevanoona Nezvekuchengetedzwa KweTanzania, Zvichiratidza Kuwedzerwa Kwekutsikira

en: African civil society campaigners attending a conference in Tanzania were questioned and warned over the weekend, in what human rights activists say is part of a continuing clampdown on free speech in the East African nation.
sna: Varwiri dzekodzero dzevagari vemuAfrica vari kumusangano mukuru uri kuitirwa kuTanzania vakabvunzurudzwa vakayambirwa pakupera kwesvondo, muchiitiko chiri kunzi nevarwiri vekodzero dzevanhu chikamu chiri kuenderera mberi chekutsikirira pasi rusunguko rwekuti vanhu vanogona kutaura zvavanoda nekufunga vakasununguka.
