en: Details are still emerging over what exactly happened to at least 40 civil society workers who ran afoul of security officials at this year's summit of the Southern African Development Community in Dar es Salaam.
sna: Zvichiri kubuda zvishoma nezvishoma zvekuti chii chaizvo chakanyatsoitika kuvashandi vasiri pasi pemakumi mana vemasangano anorwira kodzero dzevagari vakanetsana nevashandi vanoona nezvekuchengetedzwa nerunyararo munyika pamusangano mukuru wemubatanidzwa dzenyika dzekuchamhembe kweAfrica unonzi Southern African Development Community wakaitirwa muDar es Salaam.

en: But rights experts said Monday that the episode is another worrying sign of heightened paranoia and harassment from the government.
sna: Asi nyanzvi mune zvekodzero dzakati nemusi weMuvhuro kuti zvakaitika izvi chimwe chiratidzo chinoshungurudza chekuwedzerwa kwekutya mimvuri nechati kwatara nekumbunyikidzwa kuri kuitwa nehurumende.

en: Catherine Eden, a lawyer for the Tanzania Human Rights Defenders Coalition, says the incident stemmed from a misunderstanding.
sna: Catherine Eden, gweta remubatanidzwa wemasangano anorwira kodzero dzevanhu muTanzania, reTanzania Human Rights Defenders Coalition, anoti zvakaitika izvi zvakabva pakusanzwisisana.

en: South African delegates to the 15-nation conference, she said, wanted to hold a short commemoration of the seventh anniversary of South Africa's deadly Marikana mine massacre on Aug. 16.
sna: Akati vakokwa vakange vabva kuSouth Africa kumusangano wenyika gumi neshanu uyu vakange vachida kuita muchinguva chipfupi chiitiko chekurangarira zvakaitika pakapfurwa vashandi vemumigodhi kuMarikana kuSouth Africa makore manomwe apfuura musi wa 16 Nyamavhuvhu.

en: Thirty-four striking miners were killed by police in the deadliest security incident since the end of apartheid in 1994.
sna: Vashandi makumi matatu nevana vemumigodhi vakaurayiwa nemapurisa pachiitiko chisanganisira mapurisa chakaipisisa chisati chamboitika kubva pakapera kutonga kwehudzvanyiriri hwechichena mugore ra1994.

en: So delegates at a side event sang the South African anthem, held a moment of silence and availed on their government to better protect its people.
sna: Saka vakokwa vakange vari pachiitiko chaiitika necheparutivi vakaimba rwiyo rwenyika rwemuSouth Africa, ndokutora chinguva chekunyarara vachiyeuka nekuremekedza vashakabvu uye ndokuzokumbira hurumende yavo kuti idzivirire vanhu vayo nezhira dziri nani.

en: But something they wrote on a piece of paper convinced security police the delegates had bigger plans.
sna: Asi chimwe chinhu chavakanyora pachipepa chakaita kuti mapurisa agutsikane kuti vakokwa ava vaive nehurongwa hwekuita zvimwe zvinhu zvikurusa.

en: They wrote some messages on the flip charts, of which the little content that was captured in the flip charts read, 'Stop killing our people,' she said. "...
sna: Vakanyora mamwe mashoko pamapepa makuru, uye zvainge zvanyorwa pamazipepa aya zvaiti, "Regai kuuraya vanhu vedu" akadaro. "...

en: So I think there was a national security person in that meeting and he saw those messages and so he interpreted that as a plan to demonstrate.
sna: Saka ndinofunga kuti mumusangano uyu maive nemunhu anoona nezvekuchengetedzwa kwenyika, uye paakaona mashoko aya akabva afunga kuti hwaive hurongwa hwekuratidzira.

en: But if you look closely, you can't see any relationship as to why they would want to demonstrate for the Marikana shootings in Tanzania."
sna: Asi ukanyatsotarisisa, haugone kuona kuti sei vaizoda kuratidzira pamusoro pekupfurwa kwevanhu kuMarikana kuSouth Africa, asi ivo vari muTanzania."

en: It's not clear if anyone was actually arrested.
sna: Hazvina kujeka kana panotori nemunhu akasungwa.

en: Other rights groups say that some foreign campaigners were arrested, but not interrogated.
sna: Mamwe masangano ezvekodzero anoti zvizvarwa zvekune dzimwe nyika zvakasunga, asi hazvina kubvunzurudzwa.

en: Afraid, insecure'
sna: Kutya, kunzwa kusachengetedzeka'

en: Eden says she was summoned by authorities as she went to the police station Friday night to meet with a local coordinator and then was let go with a warning.
sna: Eden anoti akasheedzwa kuzoona vakuru apo ayienda kukamba yemapurisa manheru eChishanu kunoona mumwe wevaronga ari chizvarwa chemuTanzania asi ndokuzonzi aende hake asi apihwa yambiro yekusazviita futi.

en: Police later went to delegates' hotel rooms looking for materials that they thought were a security threat. They found nothing, she said.
sna: Mushure mazvo, mapurisa akazoenda mumipanda yemumahotera maigara vakokwa ava vachitsvaga zvinhu zvaifungidzira kuti zvinogona kukanganisa kuchengetedzeka kwenyika. Hapana chavakawana, akataura achidaro.

en: Janet Zhou, director of the Zimbabwe Coalition on Debt and Development, was one of the campaigners questioned by security forces at her hotel.
sna: Janet Zhou, mukuru wesangano rinoona nezvehukama huri pakati pezvikwereti zveZimbabwe negoneso yekuunza kubudirira munyika yeZimbabwe Coalition on Debt and Development, aive mumwe wevarwiri vekodzero vakabvunzurudzwa nemapurisa pahotera paaigara.

en: I was afraid, I was insecure, I was traumatized to say the least, she told VOA, after returning home to Harare.
sna: Ndakange ndavakutya, ndainzwa kuti handina kuchengetedzeka, ndisingawanze mashoko ndakasiiwa ndizere kutya nekushungurudzwa mukati mangu, akaudza VOA, mushure mekudzoka kumusha ku Harare. "Nekuti kuona vanhu vezvekuchengetedzwa kwenyika vachiuya nguva dzadarika pakati pehusiku, vachindibvunzurudza pamusoro pekuratidzira nezvinyorwa zviri pamapepa makuru andakange ndisingagone kuvapa, chaive chimwe chinhu chisionekwe. Handina kuzvihwisisa. Zvakandisiya ndichigwagwadza nekutya.

en: "Because seven security details coming over after midnight and questioning me about a demonstration and placards that I wasn't going to be able to give them, was something else. I didn't understand it. It left me really terrified."
sna: "Nekuti kuona vanhu vezvekuchengetedzwa kwenyika vachiuya nguva dzadarika pakati pehusiku, vachindibvunzurudza pamusoro pekuratidzira nezvinyorwa zviri pamapepa makuru andakange ndisingagone kuvapa, chaive chimwe chinhu chisionekwe. Handina kuzvihwisisa. Zvakandisiya ndichigwagwadza nekutya.

en: She said police then told her and her 40-person delegation to remain in their hotel all day Saturday.
sna: Akati mapurisa akazomuudza iye nevamwe vakokwa aaive navo makumi mana kuti vagare pahotera vasabude zuva rese remusi weMugovera.

en: She asked them if they were under arrest, to which they did not reply.
sna: Akavabvunza kuti vakange vavasunga here, asi havana kumupindura.

en: Perfectly valid'
sna: Zvinonyatsa Kunzwisisika'

en: Oryem Nyeko, a Kampala-based researcher for Human Rights Watch, noted that Tanzanian police didn't do anything technically illegal.
sna: Oryem Nyeko, munzveri anogara kuKampala achishandira sangano rinotarisisa nyaya dzekodzero dzevanhu reHuman Rights Watch, akati mapurisa emuTanzania haana chaakaita chinganzi chaive kuzhe kwemutemo.

en: But, he said, that doesn't make it right, either.
sna: Asi akati, izvozvo hazviitewo zvavakaita kuti zvive zvinhu zvakanaka.

en: I think it's a perfectly valid thing for police to do, he said.
sna: Ndinofunga kuti chaive chunhu chinohwisisika kuti mapurisa achiite, akadaro.

en: "However, the challenge with that is that it speaks to a wider problem in Tanzania as far as a closing civic space and the opportunities that people in civic society have to freely express themselves.
sna: "Asi zvakadaro, izvi zvinotaurawo pamusoro pedambudziko guru riri muTanzania pakuvhara dariro rekuti vanorwira kodzero dzevanhu vaitewo basa ravo uye mukana wevanhu ava kuti varatidze nekutaura zvavanoda.

en: This is part of a wider pattern of civic repression in the country."
sna: Ichi chinongova chidimbu chidoko doko chetsika yekudzvanyirirwa kwezvikwta zvinoshanda nezvekodzero nezvimwe zvinobata veruzhinji munyika ino."

en: International groups like the Committee to Protect Journalists have also warned of increased repression.
sna: Masangano anoshanda ari munyika dzakawanda akaita se sangano rinorwoira vatapi vanhau reCommittee to Protect Journalists akayambirawo nezvekuwedzerwa kwekudzvinyirirwa.

en: Ahead of the SADC summit, the watchdog group noted its concerns about a "deeply troubling erosion of press freedom," and of "attacks on individual journalists, media suspensions, internet shutdowns, and restrictive legislation."
sna: Musangano mukuru wemuSADC usati waitwa, sangano rinoongorora iri rakatura kushushikana kwaro pamusoro pe "kufukurwa nekun'en'enwa kwerusununguko rwemasangano anotapa nhau," uye "nekukurwiswa kwevatapi venhau semadungamunhu, kumiswa kwekushanda kwemasangano enhau, kuvharwa kwemadandemutande nekuiswa kwemitemo inombunyikidza nekudzivisa."

en: The CPJ made special mention of Tanzanian journalists Azory Gwanda, who has been missing since 2017, and Erick Kabendera, who was arrested last month and charged with economic crimes, which the organization says is in retaliation for his critical journalism.
sna: CPJ yakataura zvikuru sei nezvevatapi venhau vekuTanzania, Azory Gwanda, uyo asiri kuzivikanwa kwaari kubva mugore ra2017, na Erick Kabendera, uyo akasungwa mwedzi wakapfuura achipomerwa mhosva dzezvehupfumi, izvo zvinonzi nesangano iri kutsiva manyorero ake enhau anoongorora nekupenengura.

en: Kabendera remains behind bars.
sna: Kabendera anoramba ari mujeri.

en: On Monday, Eden, his lawyer, said the court decided to adjourn to give prosecutors more time to investigate.
sna: NeMuvhuro, Eden, gweta rake, akati dare redzimhosva rakange rasarudza kumbomisa kutongwa kwenyaya yake, kuti ripe vachuchusi nguva yekutsvaga humboo.

en: That will keep him in jail for more than a week longer, until Aug. 30.
sna: Izi zvichaita kuti agare muchitirongo kwerimwezve zvondo, kusvikira musi wa30 Nyamavhuvhu.

en: Worrying trend'
sna: Katsika Kanoshungurudza'

en: Anna Henga, director of the Legal and Human Rights Center, said police actions only further a worrying trend in Tanzania under President John Magafuli, whom critics say is becoming increasingly authoritarian.
sna: Anna Henga, mukuru wesangano rezvemutemo nekodzero dzevanhu reLegal and Human Rights Center, akati zviito zvemapurisa zvinongowedzera katsika kanoshungurudza kava muTanzania iri kutungamirirwa navaJohn Magafuli, avo vanonzi nevanoongorora nekunzvera vava kunyanya kutonga zvine chisimba nekudzvanyirira.

en: This means the continuation of a limited civic space.
sna: Izvi zvinoreva kuendera mberi kwedariro rakamanikana remabasa anezvechekuita nezvekodzero nezvido zvevagari vemunyika.

en: Because this has happened since 2016.
sna: Nekuti izvi zvange zvichiitika kubva muna 2016.

en: There are a lot of issues, there is a negative development toward limited civic space.
sna: Pane nyaya dzakawanda, pane kufambira mberi kusina kunaka kwakananga kudopokesa dariro revanhu vanorwira kodzero dzevanhu.

en: And it is targeted to people like civil society organizations, the media, hindering the freedom of speech, the freedom of association.
sna: Uye zvakananga kukanganisa nanhu vakaita sevaye vari mumasangano anorwira kodzero dzevanhu, masangano enhau, zvichidzivisa nekukanganisa rusununguko rwevanhu kutaura zavanoda nezvavanofunga nerusununguko rwekusangana nekuungana sezvavanoda.

en: Few Demonstrators Turn Up for Zimbabwe Protest in Bulawayo
sna: Vanhu Vashoma Vanoungana Kuti Varatidzire KuBulawayo

en: Few people have turned up for an opposition protest in Bulawayo, Zimbabwe's second city, on Monday as armed police maintained heavy presence on the streets and at a courthouse where the opposition is pressing to be allowed to hold the demonstration.
sna: Vanhu vashoma vakauya kuzopinda pakuratiszira kwakange kwarongwa nebato rinokwikwidza munezvematongerwo kuBulawayo, guta guru rechipiri muZimbabwe, nemusi weMuvhuro sezvo mapurisa akange akazara kwese kwese mumigwagwa nepavazhe dzedare redzimhosva apo bato rinokwikwidza riri kuda kuti riite kuratidzira kwaro imomo.

en: Business in Bulawayo's usually bustling downtown was subdued with the most traffic from police trucks, water cannons and dozens of police officers patrolling on foot.
sna: Mabasa ekutenga nekutengeseana munzvimbo dzeguta dzinowanzowandira veruzhinji kufamba kuzhinji kariitika kuri kwemotokari dzemapurisa, matangi emapurisa ane mvura inovava nemirwi yemapurisa vaimemaira mumigwagwa netsoka.

en: The opposition party, the Movement for Democratic Change, had called the protest as part of a planned series of demonstrations to push President Emmerson Mnangagwa to agree to a transitional government amid a rapidly deteriorating economy and rising political tensions.
sna: Bato rinopikisa reMovement for Democratic Change, rakange radeedzera kuratidzira uku chiri chikamu chehurongwa hwekuungana richiratidzira kuti rimanikidze mutungamiriri vaEmmerson Mnangagwa kuti vabvume kuita hurumende yemubatanidzwa yekudzikamisa nekuyambutsa nyika nekuda kwezvehupfumi zviri kuramba zvichiwedzera kuwondomoka nekusimuka kwekukakavadzana nekusawirirana pane zvematongerwo.

en: But the police banned the protest in the southern city, citing security concerns.
sna: Asi mapurisa akadzivisa kuratidzira uku muguta riri kuchamhembe kwenyika, vachiti vaiitira kuti pave nekuchengetedzeka nerunyararo muguta.

en: A Bulawayo magistrate is hearing the opposition party's challenge to the ban.
sna: Mumwe mutongi wedare redzimhosva muBulawayo ari kunzwa zvirikutaurwawo nebato rinopikisa richikwidzana nekudziviswa uku.

en: The protest was planned as a follow up to demonstrations held in the capital, Harare, on Friday when several hundred demonstrators marched in defiance of a police ban that was upheld by the High Court.
sna: Kuratidzira uku kwakange kwarongwa kuti kutevere kuratidzira kwakange kwaitwa muguta guru, Harare, nemusi weChishanu, uku zviuru zvakati kuti zvevairatidzira zvakafora zvisina basa nekudziviswa kwemapurisa uko kwakange kwatsigirwa nedare redzimhosva repamusoro.

en: Police used tear gas and beatings with batons to quell the Harare protest.
sna: Mapurisa akashandisa hutsi hunokachidza nekutosvoro nekurova vanhu netsvimbo kuti vamiise kuratidzira kwemuHarare.

en: Zimbabweans Claim Police Brutality During Economic Protests
sna: Vanhu VemuZimbabwe Vanoti Mapurisa Akashandisa Chisimba Nehutsinye Pakaitwa Kuratidzirwa Pane Zvehupfumi Hwenyika

en: Zimbabweans defied a police ban Friday and held demonstrations to protest the country's deteriorating economy.
sna: Vanhu vemuZimbabwe vakamhura kudzviswa kwemapurisa neChishanu vaita kuratidzira pamusoro pekunyanya kuwodomoka kwezvehupfumi munyika.

en: Despite the High Court ban on planned protests, members of the Movement for Democratic Change took to the streets and clashed with police.
sna: Kunyangwe paine kudziviswa kwakabva kudare guru redzimhosva pakuratidzira, nhengo dzeMovement for Democratic Change dzakapinda mumigwagwa dzikadhumhana nemapurisa.

en: Some of the injured accused police of derailing protests, which they said were meant to persuade President Emmerson Mnangagwa's government to breathe life into Zimbabwe's moribund economy.
sna: Vamwe vevakakuvadzwa vakapomera mapurisa ,hosva yekukanganisa gwara nechinangwa chekuratidzira uku, kwaifanirwa kukurudzira hurumende yemutungamiriri vaEmmerson Mnangagwa kuti ifemere mweya wehupenyu mune zvehupfumi hwenyika hwabatwa nechando.

en: With tears on her cheeks, 32-year-old Tafadzwa Bvuta said her degree had not helped her get anything for her three children.
sna: Misodzi ichiyerera pamatama ake, Tafadzwa Bvuta, ane makore makumi matatu nemaviri akati zvidzidzo zvake zvezvikoro zvapamusoro hazvina kumubatsira kuti awane cheuviri kuti achengete vana vake vatatu.

en: They beat us up, she said of the police.
sna: Vakati rova, akadaro achireva mapurisa.

en: "What have we done? All these security forces are supposed to protect us all not just one person. Where will we go and survive? Shall we kill our kids since we are struggling to take care of them?"
sna: "Chii chataita? Mauto nemapurisa ose aya vanofanirwa kutichengetedza tese, kwete munhu mumwe chete. Tichaendepi kuti tirarame? Saka tinofanirwa kuuraya vana vedu here sezvo tiri kutatarika kuti tivachengete?"

en: Make Nyashanu, 27, said he would continue protesting because he is miserable about being unemployed.
sna: Make Nyashanu, uyo ane makore makumi maviri nemanomwe, akati aizoramba achiratidzira nekuti atambura nekuva rovha.

en: He said police were indiscriminately beating demonstrators even elderly ones and people not protesting.
sna: Akati mapurisa kange achirova munhu wese airatidzira asingasarure, kusanganisira vechikuru, nevaya vakanga vasiri kuratidzira.

en: "Is this democracy?" he asked, adding that it was a peaceful demonstration but police were causing chaos.
sna: "Ndiro kutsaruzhinji racho here iri?" akabvunza, ndokuzowedzera achiti kwaiva kuratidzira kwaive nerunyararo asi mapurisa ndiwo akange ozokonzera mvongamupopoto.

en: The opposition said it will hold another protest Monday in Zimbabwe's second largest city, Bulawayo, and will go to other cities and places until the government addresses the economy.
sna: Bato rinopikisasa rakati raizoita kumwe kuratidzira neMuvhuro muguta guru rechipiri muZimbabwe, Bulawayo, uye vachaenda kune mamwe maguta nedzimwe nzvimbo kusvikira hurumende yagadzirisa zvehupfumi.

en: Government response
sna: Mhinduro Yehurumende

en: Information Minister Monica Mutsvangwa called the protests counterproductive, saying January's demonstrations against fuel price increases resulted in $20 million to $30 million in losses for businesses from looting and non-productive days.
sna: Gurukota rezvekufambiswa kwemashoko, Mai Monica Mutsvangwa vakati kuratidzira uku kwaikwikwidzana nebudiriro inounza pundutso, vachizve kuratidzira kwemunaNdira uku pamusoro pekukwira kwemitengo yemafuta kwakaita kuti mabhizimisi arasikirwe nemari iri pakati pemamiriyoni makumi maviri nematatu emadhora nekuda kwekubiwa kwezvvinhu nemazuva pakange pasina zvaitengwa nekutengeswa nekuda kwekuratidzira.

en: Government calls on all progressive Zimbabweans to desist from being used by negative forces to destabilize their own country, as this will only prolong the hardships which the government is tirelessly trying to address in a more sustainable manner, she said.
sna: Hurumende inokurudzira vanhu vese vemuZimbabwe vanoda budiriro kuti varambe kushandiswa nevanhu vanosundwa nezvakaipa kuti vakonzere kusagadzikana munyika yavo, nekuti izvi zvinongowedzera kuoma kwezhinhu, uko hurumende iri kushanda pasina zororo kuti igadzirise nezhira inoenderera mberi, vakadaro.

en: "I wish to reiterate the call by His Excellency Comrade ED Mnangagwa for all patriotic Zimbabweans to resort to dialogue as a means to solve the challenges we face as a nation."
sna: "Ndinoda kudzokorora nekusimbisa zvakataurwa nemukuru wenyika Vanoremekedzwa vaED Mnangagwa kuti vanhu vese vemuZimbabwe vanoda nyika yavo vanofanirwa kushandisa nhaurirano sezhira yekugadzirisa zvidenho nezvinetswa zvatakatarisana nazvo senyika.

en: Daniel Molokhele, the spokesman for the opposition, said his party was against Mnangagwa leading talks and accused him of stealing Zimbabwe's last election in 2018.
sna: Daniel Molokhele, mutauriri webato rinopikisa, akati bato rake raainge risingade kuti vaMnangagwa vatungamirire nhaurirano idzi uye ndokuvanenedzera kuti vakange vabiridzira musarudzo dzakapedzesera kuitwa muZimbabwe muna2018.

en: He said the protests would continue until Zimbabwe's economy gets back on track.
sna: Akati kuratidzira uku kwaizoenderera mberi kusvikira zvehupfumi hwenyika hadzokera panzvimbo pahwo chaipo.

en: UN Condemns Government Crackdown on Peaceful Protests in Zimbabwe
sna: UN Inoshora Kutsikirira Pasi Kwekuratidzira Kuri Kuitwa Murunyararo Nehurumende yeZimbabwe

en: The U.N. human rights office is condemning a crackdown Friday in Zimbabwe by riot police on peaceful protesters in the capital, Harare.
sna: Hofisi yeU.N. inoona nezvekodzero dzevanhu iri kushora kutsikirira pasi nemusi weChishanu nemapurisa anodzivisa mhirizhonga pavanhu vairatidzira murunraro muguta guru reHarare.

en: The agency is calling for an investigation into excessive use of force by security forces.
sna: Bazi iri riri kuti ngapave nekuongorora nekutsvakiridza mukushandiswa kwechisimba chiri kuzhe kwemwero nemapazi anochengetedza runyararo munyika.

en: U.N. Human Rights spokesman Rupert Colville says there are better ways to deal with the populations legitimate grievances on the economic situation in the country than by cracking down on peaceful protestors.
sna: Mutauririri weU.N. Human Rights, Rupert Colville anoti pane zhira dziri nani dzekugadzirisa kuchema kwekurevesa kuri kubva muvanhu vemunyika pamusoro pemamiriro ezvehupfumi munyika pane kutsikirira nekurova vanhu vari kuratidzira murunyararo.

en: We are deeply concerned by the socio-economic crisis that continues to unfold in Zimbabwe.
sna: Tiri kushushikana zvikuru nemadambudziko ezvemagariro nezvehupfumi ari kuramba achirudunuka muZimbabwe.

en: While acknowledging efforts made by the government, the international community and the U.N. in Zimbabwe to mitigate the effects of the crisis and reform process, the dire economic situation is now impacting negatively on the realization of economic and social rights of millions of Zimbabweans, Colville said.
sna: Kunyange hazvo ndichigamuchira zviri kuedzwa kuitwa nehurumende, mhuri yenyika dzepasi rose ne U.N. muZimbabwe kuti pave nekuderedza zvinorwadza zvirikubva padambudziko iri uye nezvirikuitwa kuunza shanduko, nyatwa yezvehupfumi yavakurovawo kodzero panezvehupfumi nemagariro emamiriyoni evanhu vemuZimbabwe, Colville akadaro.

en: Zimbabwes citizens are struggling with hyperinflation, which has sent prices soaring for essential commodities such as fuel, food, transportation and health care.
sna: Vagari vemuZimbabwe vari kutambura nekukwira kwemitengo kuri kunzerwa nemari yenyika iri kushaiwa simba rekutenga, zvo zvaita kuti mitengo iite zvekusvetukira mudenga pazvinhu zvinodiwa neruzhinji zuva nezuva zvakadai semafuta ezvifambiso, chikafu, mari yekufambisa nehutano.

en: Compounding the problems is the ongoing impact of cyclone Idai that hit Zimbabwe in March and a severe drought.
sna: Zvabva zvawedzera kujambwa iri kuparadzwa kuri kubva kudutumupengo Idai iro rakarova Zimbabwe munaKurume, uyewo nekushaiwa mvura zvakakonzera kuti zvirimwa zvitsire muminda.

en: The United Nations says one third of Zimbabwes population of 16 million people is in need of humanitarian aid.
sna: United Nations inoti chikamu chimwe chete kubva muzvitatu chevagari vemuZimbabwe vanosvika mamiriyoni gumi nematanhatu vanoda kubatsirwa kuti vararame zvezuva nezuva

en: The fallout in terms of casualties and possible arrests from Fridays protests is not yet clear.
sna: Hudzamu hwezvakakonzerwa nekukuvadzwa nekusungwa kunogona kwakaitika mushure mekuratidzira kweChishanu hahusati hwanyatsojeka. Asi Colville anoudza VOA kuti hofisi yake yakagamuchira chinyorwa cheongororo chaitaura nezvekutyorwa kwekodzero dzevanhu mumwedzi mishoma ichangodarika.

en: But Colville tells VOA his office has received disturbing reports of human rights violations over the past few months.
sna: Asi Colville anoudza VOA kuti hofisi yake yakagamuchira chinyorwa cheongororo chaitaura nezvekutyorwa kwekodzero dzevanhu mumwedzi mishoma ichangodarika.

en: There are, as I said, reports coming through right now of very recent abductions, beatings and so on of activists or human rights defenders.
sna: Sezvandareva, pane zvinyorwa zveongororo zviri kutumirwa zvekubvutwa kwevanhu, kurohwa nezvimwe zvakadaro zvevanhu vanorwira kodzero dzakasiyana siyana kusanganisira vanorwira kodzero dzevanhu.

en: We have not had a chance to verify those and look in detail apart from the two that occurred a few days ago, Colville said.
sna: Hatisati tawana mukana wekuti tinzvere kuti tione kaka chiri chokwadi, kuzhe kwezvakaitika mumazuva maviri apfuura, Colville akataura achidaro.

en: "So, it is clearly a very tense situation."
sna: "Saka mamiriro ezvinhu akakakwa sewaya inogona kudambuka."

en: Colville says state authorities have a duty to ensure peoples rights to freedom of expression and to protect the right to peaceful assembly.
sna: Colville says state authorities have a duty to ensure peoples rights to freedom of expression and to protect the right to peaceful assembly.

en: The U.N. human rights office is urging the government to engage in a national dialogue to ensure that civil society in all its guises can carry out its activities without fear of intimidation or reprisals for its work.
sna: Hofisi yeU.N. inoona nezvekodzero dzevanhu is kurudzira hurumende kuti itange nhaurirano dzinosanganisira vanhu vese vemunyika kuti ione kuti masangano evagare neanorwira kodzero devanhu vanoita mabasa avo vasina kutya kuti pane zvakaipa zvinozovatera.

en: Despite Oil and Gas Reserves, Africa Feels Pressure of Rising Energy Costs
sna: Kunyangwe Iine Hupfumi Hwemafuta Ekufambisa Nemweya Unocherwa Kubva Pasi (Gas) Zvisati Zvacherwa Kubva Pai, Africa Yogwabvurwa Nekukwira Kwemitengo yemafuta ekufambisa nemweya wekubikisa

en: Africans are feeling the pinch caused by soaring global energy prices, say analysts, even in countries like Nigeria and Angola that are major exporters of crude oil.
sna: Vanhu vemuAfrica vari kunzwa kurwadza kuri kunzorerwa nekukwira kwemafuta pasi rose, vaongorori vanodaro, kunyangwe munyika dzakaita seNigeria neAngola dzinova dzimwe huru pakutengesa mafuta aya kune dzimwe nyika.

en: While that handful of oil producers is seeing an increase in revenue especially since the Russian invasion of Ukraine on February 24 much of the continent lacks refining capability, forcing countries to pay high prices to import gasoline and other petroleum products from Asia and Europe.
sna: Kunyanyangwe hazvo kuine nyika shomanana dzinochera mafuta dziri kuwedzera pamari  yadzinowana kubva mumafuta zvikuru sei mushure mekupinda kweRussia zvine chisima muUkraine musi waKukadzi 24, dunhu guru reAfrica harina goneso yekugadzira mafuta adzinenge dzachera, zvinozomanikidza nyika idzi kubhadhara mari yapamusoro kuti dzitenge mafuta edzimotokari nezvimwe zvinobuda mumafuta ekuchera aya kubva kuAsia nekuEurope.

en: The continent is further affected by increasing costs for natural gas, a key component of nitrogen-based fertilizers used in food production.
sna: Dunhu reAfrica riri kukanganiswawo nekwedzera kudhura kwemweya unocherwa kubva pasi, ayo anokosha zvikuru pakugadzira mafotereza anobva mu nitrogen ayo anoshandiswa mukurima zvekudya.

en: With salaries largely stagnant, more than two-thirds of Africans feel pressured by the rising prices, said Franklin Cudjoe, founding president of the Ghana-based Imani Center for Policy and Education.
sna: Nekuda kwekuti mihoro yevashandi haisi kusimukira, zvikamu zvinodarika zviviri kubva muzvitatu zviri kunzwa kuiswa pakamanikana nekutenda kwemitengo iri kuramba ichikwira, akadaro Franklin Cudjoe, mutungamiriri sangano rekuGhana rinonzi Imani Center for Policy and Education.

en: The continent is affected simply because we depend largely on global oil suppliers, since not many African countries have [their own] oil products, Cudjoe told VOA.
sna: Dunhu riri kukanganisika nekuti tinozembera nekuraramiswa nemakambani anotengesera mafuti kunyika dzepasi rose, sezvo hadzisi nyika zhinji dzemuAfrica dzine zvigadzirwa zvadzo zvinobuda kubva mumafuta, Cudjoe akaudza VOA.

en: Prices spiked on the global oil market after the invasion of Ukraine triggered a wave of international sanctions against Russia, one of the worlds leading exporters of crude.
sna: Mutengo wemafuta wakakwira zvikuru pamusika wemafuta pasi rose mushure mekupindirwa zvine ganyavhu nezvombo kwaitwa muUkraine, izvo zvakakonzera dutu rezvirango zvehupfumi zvekusatengeserana neRussia, imwe yenyika dziri pamberi pakutengesera dzimwe nyika mafuta maari munozobuda zvigadzirwa zvakasiyana siyana.

en: The price briefly climbed to over $120 per barrel this month before settling down to $103 per barrel on Friday.
sna: Mutengo wakakwira kwechinguvana kudarika madhora zana nemakumi maviri pazidhiramu rimwe chete mwedzi uno, asi ndookuzoderera ukange wava pazana nemadhora matatu nemusi weChishanu.

en: The surge in energy prices is helping to fuel inflation across Africa.
sna: Kusvetukira kumusoro kwemitengo yezvicherwa zvinoshandiswa kufambisa mishina nezvifambiso uye pakubika nekudziisa dzimba zviri kubatsira kuwedzera kudhura kwezvinhu nekushaiwa simba kwemari dzenyika dzemuAfrica.

en: In Ghana, for example, overall consumer price inflation was pegged at 15.7% year-on-year in February compared with 13.9% in January, the countrys Statistical Service said last week.
sna: MuGhana, semuyenzaniso, kuwedzera kwekudhura kwemitengo yezvinhu zvekushandisa kwegore negore kwakange kwaonekwa kuri pazvikamu gumi nezvishanu nezvidimbu zvisere kubva muzana muna Kukadzi zviciyenzaniswa nezvikamu gumi nezvitatu nezvidimbu zvisere kubva muzana muna Ndira, bazi rinoongora huwandu hwevanhu vezvinhu muGhana reStatistical Service rakataura richidaro svondo rakapera.

en: In Zimbabwe, prices are climbing sharply even overnight.
sna: MuZimbabwe, mitengo iri kukwira zvikuru, pamwe pacho mazuva ese.

en: At a TM supermarket in the capital of Harare, a crate of 30 eggs cost the $6.70 on Tuesday and about $7.81 on Wednesday.
sna: Pachitoro chikuru chinonzi TM supermarket chiri muguta guru reHarare, bhokisi remazai makumi matatu raitengeswa nemadhora matanhatu nenasezi makumi manomwe neChipiri asi nemadora manomwe nemakumi manomwe nerimwe emasenzi neChitatu.

en: The price of a loaf of bread went from $1.49 to $1.84; for a kilo of beef, the price jumped from $3.35 to $5.22.
sna: Mutengo wechingwa wakabva padhora rimwe chete neasenzi makumi mana nemapfumbamwe kuenda padhora nemasenzi makumi masere nemana; chiyero chimwe chete che kilogram yenyama yemombe chakasvetuka kubva pamadora matatu nemasenzi makumi matatu nemashanu kuenda kumadhora mashanu nemasenzi makumi maviri nemaviri.

en: Gasoline costs climbed, too.
sna: Mafuta ezvifambiso akakwirawo.

en: In Harare, the per-liter price climbed from $1.41 to $1.69 from Tuesday to Wednesday.
sna: MuHarare, mutengo weliter rimwe chete wakakwira kubva padhora nemasenzi makumi mana nerimwe kuenda kudhora nemasenzi matanhatu nemapfumbamwe kubva musi weChipiri kupinda mumusi weChitatu.

en: The surge in food prices was the biggest driver behind consumer inflation in Egypt, it rose by 8.8% in February the sharpest increase in nearly three years, according to the state statistics agency, CAPMAS.
sna: Kukwirira kwemitengo ndicho chinhu chikuru chasundira mberi kushaiwa simba rekutenga kwemari yemuEgypt, kwakawedzera nezvikamu zvisere nezvidimbu zvisere kubva muxana munaKukadzi, kuwedzera kwakakwiririsa munguva ingapotse isvike makore matatu, sekutaurwa kwazvakaitwa nebandiko rnoongora kuwanda kwevanhu nezvinhu muEgypt, reCAPMAS.

en: Cudjoe said it was crucial for governments and regional bodies such as the African Union to build defenses to cushion consumers in times of economic uncertainty.
sna: Cudjoe akati zvakosha kuti hurumende nemasangano anoshanda mumatunhu akaita seMubatanidzwa weAfrica kana kuti African Union vavake zvinhu zvinodzivirira vatengi munguva yekusagadzikana pane zvehupfumi.

en: Even if it means building defenses in terms of the provision of food, said Cudjoe, adding, "I could imagine Nigeria, if it had had its way, it could be selling foodstuff to most countries at reduced rates by now."
sna: Kunyangwe zvichireva kuvaka kudzivirira panyaya dzekupa vanhuzvekudya, akadaro Cudjoe, achitizve, "Ndiri kuedza kufunga neNigeria, deno yaigona kuzviita nezhira iyi, ingadeyi yotengesera dzimwe nyika chikafu nemari yaderera ikezvino."

en: There must be that urgency of building for themselves defenses, funds that would make us sustain ourselves -- at least to prevent us from being completely annihilated by these uncertainties in the world.
sna: Panofanirwa kuva nechimbi chimbi yakadai yekti dzizvivakire kuzvichengetedza, mari dzaizogona kutiita kuti tirambe tichienderera mberi nekurarama -- kuti zvitiponese pakubva taparadzwa zvachose nezvinhu zvinoitika zvisina anoziva kana kufungidzirazvinoitika pasi rose.

en: Chibamba Kanyama, an economist in the Zambian capital of Lusaka, said suspending fuel taxes would be "the most ideal thing to do now under the circumstances" to cushion consumers and industries.
sna: Chibamba Kanyama, nyanzvi munezvehupfumi muguta guru reZambia reLusaka, akati kumbomiswa kubhadharwa kwemitengo yemafuta kwazove "chinhu chakanakisisa kuita mumamiriro ezvinhu akadai" kuitira kufukidzira vatengi nemakambani anogadzira zvinhu.

en: African governments must find a way of responding, he said.
sna: Hurumende dzemuAfrica dzinofanirwa kuwana nzira dzekupindira nepindura akadaro, akadaro.

en: It is a choice of whether to reduce taxes to lower the prices or to maintain the price levels and use the revenues to subsidize the most vulnerable in society."
sna: Isarudzo iri pakati pekuti mitero yederedzwa here kuti mitengo iramba iri payange iri nekushandisa mari dzinobhadharwa kuhurumende kuti dzishandiswe kubhadharirawo vagari vemunyika vanenenge vasina simba rekuzvibatsira nekuzviraramisa."

en: But Kanyama also suggested that the geopolitical crisis involving Russia and Ukraine both big grain exporters to Africa may create opportunities for African producers.
sna: Asi Kanyama akapawo zano rekuti mhirizhonga yekugarisana mudunhu rimwe chete rakavhengana nezvematongerwo riri pakati peRussia neUkraine "dzose mbiri dziri nyika dzinotengesera Africa chibage negorosi zvakawanda", zvaigona kupawo mukana kuvarimi vemuAfrican.

en: Supply countries like South Africa, with robust and highly mechanized systems, may find a window of exporting [commodities] like wheat and other products to fill the gaps left by Russia and Ukraine, Kanyama said.
sna: Nyika dzinotengesa zvinhu dzakaita seSouth Africa, idzo dzine midziyo yekushandisa yakarongeka ichi shanda zvakanaka, inogona kuwana mukana wekutengesa zvinhu zvakaita segorosi and zvimwe kuti ioinde nekuzadzisa mikaha yakasiiwa yakashama neRussia neUkraine, Kanyama akadaro.

en: Kanyama also said support by the international community for instance, in the form of debt relief for some African nations is welcome.
sna: Kanyama akatiwo rubetsero rwenyika zvinji dzepasi rose nenzira dzakaita sekubvisirwa zvikwereti zvisati zvabhadharwa nedzimwe nyika dzemuAfrica chinhu chinochingamidzwa.

en: He noted that the Group of 20 which encompasses seven industrialized nations, some countries with strong or fast-growing economies, and the European Union "is trying to offer some debt relief."
sna: Akatiwo mubatanidzwa wenyika makumi maviri kana kuti Group of 20 iro rinosanganisira nyika nomwe dzakaburirira kudarika dzimwe pamishina inoshandiswa kugadzira zvinhu, asi uine nyika dzine zvepfumi zvakasima kana kuti zviri kukura nekukasira pamwe chete nemubatanidzwa wenyika dzemuEurope, European Union "uri kuedza kuti ipe kubviswa kana kuderedzwa kwezvikwereti zvanaga zvichifanirwa kubhadharwa."

en: Some other countries, such as Zambia, [are] undergoing debt restructuring processes and an IMF program, and to me, this is the only way out of the crisis, Kanyama added.
sna: Dzimwe nyika dzakaita  seZambia, [dziri kugadzirisa zhira dzekuti dzibhadhare zvikwereti] zviri muhurongwa hweona kuti zvikwereti izvi zvoderedzwa sei pamwe chete nechirongwa cheIMF, uye kwandiri, iyi ndiyo yoga nzira yekubuda kubva mudambudziko iri, akadaro Kanyama.

en: This story originated in VOA's English-to-Africa service, with contributions from the Zimbabwe service.
sna: Nhau idzi dzakabikwa nebandiko reVOA rinounza nhau dzeChirungu kuAfrica rinonzi English-to-Africa service, asi paine zvimwewo zvakaunzwa nechikamu cheVOA chiri muZimbabwe.

en: Zimbabwe Government Orders Vaccinated Workers Back to Work
sna: Hurumende YeZimbabwe Inoraira Vashandi Vakabaiwa Jekiseni Rekudzivirira Denda Kuti Vadokere Kumabasa

en: Zimbabwes government has ordered civil servants who are vaccinated against COVID-19 to immediately report for duty after more than a year of working from home, citing a declining in new cases of the virus in the country.
sna: Hurumende yeZimbabwe yaraira vashandi vayo vakabaiya jekiseni rekudzivirira denda reCOVID-19 kuti vachidzokera kubasa ikezvino mushure menguva inodarika gore vachishanda vari kumba, ichiti huwandu hwevanhu vari kubatwa nedenda iri huri kuderera munyika.

en: Authorities also announced any government workers without proof of vaccination will be barred from workplaces and face punishments, including a freeze on their salaries.
sna: Vakuru vakazivisawo kuti vashandi vese vehurumedne vasina humboo hwekubaiwa dziviriro vacharambidzwa kupinda munzvimbo dzavanoshandira, uye vanozorangwa, kusanganisira kumbomisirwa marodzavo dzemihoro.

en: In a statement this week, President Emmerson Mnangagwas government said it wants its employees to resume meeting in person.
sna: Mumashoko akabuda iro svondo rino, hurumende yavaEmmerson Mnangagwa yakati inoda vashandi vayo kuti vachitanga kuuya kusangana kumabasa mbune.

en: Late Tuesday, Monica Mutsvangwa, the countrys information minister, said the number of people being hospitalized for COVID-19 is on a steady decline.
sna: Manheru eChipiri Mai Monica Mutsvangwa, gurukota rezvekufambiswa kwemashoko munyika, vakati huwandu hwevanhu vari kupihwa mibhedha kuzvipatara nekuda kweCOVID-19 hwuri kuderera zvinyoro nyoro.

en: This indicates that the national response measures instituted by government continue to pay off.
sna: Izvi zvinoratidza kuti matanho akatorwa nehurumene munyika yese akatangwa nehurumende ari kuburitsa zvibereko zvakanaka.

en: In view of the continued decline in new cases and deaths, coupled with a declining testing positivity rate that is indicating that the community transmission has gone down, all ports of entry [are to] be reopened, but ensuring that all the recommended COVID-19 prevention measures are adhered to, she said.
sna: Nekuda kwekuderera kuri kuramba kuchiitika muvanhu vari kubatwa nedenda iri kekutanga uye ndufu nekuda kwedenda iri, zvichisanganiswawo nehuwandu hwevanhu vari kuwanikwa vasina denda iri zvinoratidza kuti huwandu hwekutapuriranwa kwedenda iri munzvimbi dzigere vanhu hwaderera, nzvimbo dzese dzinoshandiswa kupinda munyika zavakuvhurwa zvekara, asi paine matanho ekuona kuti zvinofanirwa kuitwa kudzivirira denda iri zvose zvaitwa nemazvo, vakadaro

en: However, the compulsory vaccination rule is not being welcomed by all civil servants.
sna: Zvisineyi, mutemo wekumakidza munhu wese kubaiwa majekiseni ekudzivirira hausi kutambirwa nevashandi vese vehurumende.

en: Obert Masaraure, the president of the Amalgamated Rural Teachers Union of Zimbabwe, says the workers will take the matter to court if the government insists.
sna: Obert Masaraure, mutungamiriri wemusangano wevadzidzisi vekumaruwa weAmalgamated Rural Teachers Union of Zimbabwe, anoti vashandi vachendesa nyaya iyi kumatatre kana hurumende ikasimbirira nayo.

en: A contract that was signed by civil servants has no provision for mandatory vaccination.
sna: Chibvumirano chakagamuchirwa nevashandi vehurumende chakanga chisina painzi vanomanikidzwa kubaiwa majekiseni ekudzivirira matenda mandatory vaccination.

en: So if the Public Service Commission wants to bar civil servants who are not vaccinated, they are in breach of contract and its unacceptable.
sna: Saka kana bazi rezvevashandi vehurumende rePublic Service Commission richida kudzivisa vashandi vehurumende vasina kubaiwa majekiseni ekudzivirira denda, rinenge ravakutotyora chibvumirano chebasa, uye izvi hazvigamuchirike zvachose.

en: Secondly, civil servants have a right to dignity, they have right to make choices.
sna: Chepiri, vashandi vehurumende vane kodzero yekuremekedzwa, vane kodzero yekuita sarudzo dzavanoda.

en: No one can be forced foreign substances to be inserted into their bodies, he noted.
sna: Hapana anofanirwa kumanikidzwa kubaiwa zvinhu zvaasingazive mumiviri wavo, akataura avhidaro.

en: Dr. Norman Matara, the head of Zimbabwe Association for Doctors for Human Rights, says his organization has noted that several other countries are moving towards compulsory vaccination.
sna: Dr. Norman Matara, mukuru wesangano raanachiremba vanorwira kodzero dzevanhu muZimbabwe, reZimbabwe Association for Doctors for Human Rights, vanoti sangano ravo riri kuona kuti nyika zhinji dzavakufamba dzakananga kwekumanikidzira vanhu vese kuti vabaiwe majekiseni ekudzivirira denda iri.

en: It is something that we are strongly against.
sna: Chinhu chatinokwikwidzana nacho zvachose.

en: We think mandating vaccines is something that fuels vaccine hesitance.
sna: Tinofunga kuti kumanikidzira kubaiwa kunowedzera kuti pazove nekusada kubaiwa.

en: There is a lot of conspiracy theory that goes around when people are saying we are being forced to be vaccinated.
sna: Pane nhema dzakawanda nezvirehwarehwa zvinozofambiswa kana vanhu vakati tiri kumanikidzwa kunzi tibaiwe majekiseni anodzivirira denda.

en: We really have to get the buy in of people: spread the gospel of vaccines, how they work and then encourage people to get vaccinated and not force them to get vaccinated, he pointed out.
sna: Tinofanirwa kuwana kugamuchirwa nekufarirwa kwechirongwa ichi: kuparidza dama rakanaka remishonga inodzivirira denda, anoshanda sei, pedzezvo tozokurudzira vanhu kuti vabaiwe, kwete vekuita zvekumanikidza, akatsinhidzira achidaro.

en: But Sifiso Ndlovu from the Zimbabwe Teachers Association supports the governments position.
sna: Asi vaSifiso Ndlovu vekuZimbabwe Teachers Association vanotsigira maonero nezviri kuitwa nehurumende.

en: Definitely, all workers should take up the vaccination.
sna: Zvomene, vashandi vese vanofanirwa kubaiwa majekiseni ekudzivirira.

en: Not because they want to protect themselves, but they want to protect their colleagues at work.
sna: Kwete nekuti vanoda kuzvichengetedza, asi nekuti vanoda tochengetedza vanhu vavanoshanda navo kumabasa.

en: Scientific evidence has it that if you are fully vaccinated it comes with a mild attack.
sna: Humboo weruzivo rwemazuvano rwesainzi rwunoti kana wakabaiwa majekiseni ekudzivirira ese denda iri rinokurwisa asi risina simba nehukasha zvachose.

en: Why not take up that? There is nothing wrong or sinister about it, he said.
sna: Saka tingagorambireyi kubaiwa? Hapana chakaipa kana chisinganzwisisike pamusoro pazvo, vakadaro.

en: About 3.3 million people in Zimbabwe have received two shots of the COVID-19 vaccines, while about 86,000 have received a third jab.

en: A number of Zimbabweans have refused to get vaccinated, saying they do not trust the mainly donated Chinese-made Sinopharm and Sinovac vaccines.

en: Zimbabwe Government Suspends Striking Teachers
sna: Hurumende YeZimbabwe Inombomisa Vadzidzisi Vari Kuramwa Mabasa

en: Authorities in Zimbabwe have suspended striking teachers for three months without pay in a dispute that will see most schools remain closed.
sna: Vakuru muZimbabwe vambomisa kubva pakushanda kwemwedzi mitatu vasingapihwe mihoro vadzidzisi munyaya yekusawirirana pamari yekutambira izvo zvichaita kuti zvikoro zvirambe zvakavharwa.

en: The teachers went on strike this week over their compensation.
sna: Vadzidzisi vakaramwa mabasa svobdo rino pamusoro penyaya dzemari yavanotambira.

en: Evelyn Ndlovu, Zimbabwes minister of primary and secondary education, said late Thursday that striking teacher have been suspended due to their reluctance to resume work despite the governments offer to give them a 20 percent salary hike and additional incentives.
sna: Amai Evelyn Ndlovu, gurukota rinoona nezvedzidzo yepasi muZimbabwe, nemusi weChina mauro vakati vadzidzisi vari kuramwa mabasa vambomiswa kushanda nekuda kweramba kwavo kuti vadzokere kubasa kunyangwe  hazvo hurumende yakange yati inoda kuvawedzera mihoro yavo nezvikamu makumi maviri kubva muzana nekuvapawo zvimwe zvidobi zvekuti vafarire kushanda.

en: All officials within the ministry who absented themselves from duty since the opening of schools on 7th February, 2022 have been suspended without pay forthwith for a period of three-month.
sna: Vashandi vese vehurumende vakazvirovhesa pabasa kubva pavhurwa zvikoro musi wa7 Kukadzi, 2022 vambomiswa kushanda vasingatambire mihoro kwenguva inoita mwedzi mitatu. Munguva iyi, nhengo idzi hadzifanirwe kumisa kana kukanganisa kuferefetwa kwenyaya kana humboo hune chekuita nekusabata ravo nemazvo kwavari kufungidzrwa kuti vakaita, vakadaro Amai Ndlovu. "Matanho akaringana achazotorwa pamusoro penhengo dzinosiya nekuramwa mabasa adzo nezvadzinotarisirwa kunge dzichiita."

en: During this period, members are not to hinder or interfere with any investigations or evidence relating to the alleged misconduct, said Ndlovu.
sna: Munguva iyi, nhengo idzi hadzifanirwe kumisa kana kukanganisa kuferefetwa kwenyaya kana humboo hune chekuita nekusabata ravo nemazvo kwavari kufungidzrwa kuti vakaita, vakadaro Amai Ndlovu.

en: "Appropriate action will be taken against members who abrogate their duties and responsibilities."
sna: "Matanho akaringana achazotorwa pamusoro penhengo dzinosiya nekuramwa mabasa adzo nezvadzinotarisirwa kunge dzichiita."

en: Zimbabwes schools were scheduled to reopen this week after a long break caused by the COVID-19 pandemic.
sna: Zvikoro zvemuZimbabwe zvakange zvanzi zvinovhurwa zvekare svondo rino mushure mekumbomiswa zvisingashande kwenguva refu, izvo zvakange zvakonzerwa nedenda reCOVID-19.

en: But teachers refused to resume working, asking for a pay increase.
sna: Asi vadzidzisi vakaramba kusimudzira kushanda, vachikumbira kuti mihoro yavo iwedzerwe.

en: They currently earn about $100 a month.
sna: Pari zvino, vanotambira mari ingapotse isvike zana remadhora ekuAmerica.

en: The government Tuesday offered them a 20 percent pay increase and other incentives, such as free school fees for their children and loans for housing.
sna: Hurumende nemusi weChipiri yakati yaida kuvawedzera mari yavanotambira nezvikamu makumi maviri kubva muzana pamwe nezviwewo zvaiyaizovapa zvakaita sekudzidzisirwa vana vavo mahara nemari dzechikwereti dzekuti vavake dzimba dzavo. Asi vadzidzisi vari kuramba zvavari kutambidzwa vachiti hazvikwane.

en: But the teachers have rejected that offer as insufficient.
sna: Asi vadzidzisi vari kuramba zvavari kutambidzwa vachiti hazvikwane.

en: Obert Masaraure, the president of the Amalgamated Rural Teachers Union of Zimbabwe, told VOA the suspended educators are making an urgent application to the High Court to declare their suspension illegal.
sna: VaObert Masaraure, mutungamiriri weAmalgamated Rural Teachers Union of Zimbabwe, akaudza VOA kuti vadzidzisi vakambomiswa mabasa ava vari kukumbira nechimbi chimbi kuti dare redzimhosva repamusoro reHigh Court riti kumiswa kwemabasa uku kuri kunze kwemutemo.

en: Public service regulation clearly articulates clear guidelines on how people can be suspended.
sna: Mutemo wevashandi vehurumende unonyatsotsetsenura kuti vanhu vanogona kumiswa basa kana zvichinge zvaita sei. Hatisi nyika yekuti chero zvazvaita bhurugwa rebenzi, mekuti ani naani zvake anongomuka ototura mashoko akapesana zvachose nemunoreva mutemo, akadaro Masaraure. " Tatoona kuti gurukota razvibvisa kubva pamutemo, naizvozvo havachagone kuti ritaura zviri pamutemo panyaya dzezvedzidzo, nekuti vakaita zvinopesana nekutyora bumbiro remutemo apo vari vega sedungamunhu vakangomisa vadzidzisi vemuZimbabwe. Tinovaona nekuvatora sekuti ivo ndivo vakamiswa pabasa nekuti zvavaita zvaive kunze kwemutemo."

en: We are not in a banana republic where anyone can wake up and make pronouncements which are detached and divorced from the law, said Masaraure.
sna: Hatisi nyika yekuti chero zvazvaita bhurugwa rebenzi, mekuti ani naani zvake anongomuka ototaura mashoko akapesana zvachose nemunoreva mutemo, akadaro Masaraure.

en: "We note that the minister has withdrawn herself from the law, therefore cannot be able to speak legally on education (matters) because she has acted unconstitutionally by arbitrarily suspending teachers of Zimbabwe.
sna: " Tatoona kuti gurukota razvibvisa kubva pamutemo, naizvozvo havachagone kuti ritaura zviri pamutemo panyaya dzezvedzidzo, nekuti vakaita zvinopesana nekutyora bumbiro remutemo apo vari vega sedungamunhu vakangomisa vadzidzisi vemuZimbabwe.

en: We deem her suspended as she has acted outside the law."
sna: Tinovaona nekuvatora sekuti ivo ndivo vakamiswa pabasa nekuti zvavaita zvaive kunze kwemutemo."

en: The pay dispute goes back to October 2018, when the government stopped paying teachers in U.S. dollars, switching to the reintroduced Zimbabwean dollar.
sna: Kusawirirana pamihoro kwakatanga munaGumiguru ra2018, apo hurumende yakamira kubhadhara nashandi vayo nemadhora emari yekuAmerica, yava kushandisa madhora emuZimbabwe ayakange yadzosa zvekare.

en: The new currency has steadily lost value, effectively reducing their wages.

en: The Zimbabwe Teachers Association the instructors biggest union - said it is hoping to meet with government officials soon to discuss the suspensions.
sna: Musangano wevadzidzisi weZimbabwe Teachers Association unova musangano wevadzidzisi kudarika mimwe yose - yakati iri kutarisira kusangana nevakuru vehurumende muchinguva chipfupi chiri kutevera kuti vataurirane nex]zvekumiswa kushanda kwevadzidzisi uku.

en: Zimbabwe Teachers, Calling Pay Insufficient, Refuse to Teach
sna: Vadidzisi VemuZimbabweVachiti Mihoro Haikwane, Vanoramba Kudzidzisa

en: Many Zimbabwean schools that closed because of the COVID-19 pandemic remain shuttered as teachers refuse to return to the classroom, citing a need for better pay.
sna: Zvikoro zvizhinji zvemuZimbabwe zvakavharwa nekuda kwedenda reCOVID-19 zvaramba zvakavharwa sezvo vadzidzisi vari kuramba kudzokera mudzimba dzekudzidzira, vachiti vanoda muhoro uri nani.

en: The teachers are paid less than $100 a month.
sna: Vadzidzisi vanotambira mari iri pasi pezana remadhora ekuAmerica.

en: The government has offered a 20 percent pay increase and other incentives, but the teachers have rejected that offer as insufficient.
sna: Hurumende yakati inogona kuvawedzera mihoro yavo nezvikamu makumi maviri kubva muzana, nezvimwewo zvinovakurudzira kushanda, asi vadzidzisi vakaramba zvaida kupihwa vachiti hazvikwane.

en: Meanwhile, some youths are studying independently.
sna: Zvichakadaro, vamwe vechidiki, vari kuzviverengera nekuzvidzidzira vari vega vasina mudzidzisi. Zvinoita sekuti tiri kubhara mari yekuchikoro mahara pasina chinobudako. Zvinorwadza chaizvo nekuti vabereki vangu vari kutambura kuwana mari iyoyo asi ini ndisiri kudzidza zvachose."

en: One such student, a 16-year-old, said, "My appeal [to the government] is for a salary increment for teachers so that they come to work, because we arent learning.
sna: Mumwe mudzidzi akadaro, uyo ane makore gumi nematanhatu, akati, "Chikumbiro changu [kuhurumende] ndechekuwedzerwa kwemari dzinotambirwa nevadzidzisi kuitira kuti vauye kubasa, nekuti hatisi kudzidza.

en: Its like we are paying fees for nothing.
sna: Zvinoita sekuti tiri kubhara mari yekuchikoro mahara pasina chinobudako.

en: Its so painful as my parents are struggling for it when I am not learning at all."
sna: Zvinorwadza chaizvo nekuti vabereki vangu vari kutambura kuwana mari iyoyo asi ini ndisiri kudzidza zvachose."

en: The pay dispute goes back to October 2018, when the government stopped paying teachers in U.S. dollars, switching to the reintroduced Zimbabwean dollar.
sna: Kusawirirana pamihoro kwakatanga munaGumiguru ra2018, apo hurumende yakamira kubhadhara nashandi vayo nemadhora emari yekuAmerica, yava kushandisa madhora emuZimbabwe ayakange yadzosa zvekare. en: The new currency has steadily lost value, effectively reducing teachers' wages.

en: Obert Masaraure, president of the Amalgamated Rural Teachers Union of Zimbabwe, said the instructors want their old salaries restored and that the offer of a 20 percent raise amounted to almost nothing.
sna: Obert Masaraure, mukuru weAmalgamated Rural Teachers Union of Zimbabwe, akati vadzidzisi vari kuda kuti mihoro yavasitambira kareko idzoswe, uya akati kuwedzerwa kwezvikamu makumi maviri kubva muzana kuri kuda kuitwa hakuna zvakunoreva zvachose.

en: We asked for the restoration of salaries, which were robbed from us by the government of the day, Masaraure said.
sna: Takakumbira kuti mihoro idzoserwe payayisiva, yatakabirwa hehurumende iri kutonga, akadaro Masaraure. "Uye shoko redu kuhurumende rakanyatsojeka: Tiri kuda mari yataitambira tisati tasvika munaGumiguru wa2018 yemazana mashanu nemakumi mana emadhora ekuAmerica. Tinonyatsoziva chitsotsi nechikiribidi chese chekuwedzera dhora rimwe chete kumihoro yedu "zvisina zvazvinoreva"

en: "And the message to the government is clear: We need our pre-October 2018 salaries of 540 dollars U.S.
sna: "Uye shoko redu kuhurumende rakanyatsojeka: Tiri kuda mari yataitambira tisati tasvika munaGumiguru wa2018 yemazana mashanu nemakumi mana emadhora ekuAmerica.

en: We know these shenanigans of adding an extra dollar to our salaries that does not add up."
sna: Tinonyatsoziva chitsotsi nechikiribidi chese chekuwedzera dhora rimwe chete kumihoro yedu "zvisina zvazvinoreva".

en: Government officials see the ongoing talks in a different light and voice optimism about a successful resolution.
sna: Vakuru muhurumende vari kuona nhaurirano idzi nenzira yakasiyana, uye vari kutaura vaine tarisiro nekugutsikana yekuti nyaya iyi ichapenderwa nekupedzeswa mune zvakanaka.

en: Paul Mavima, Zimbabwe's minister of public service, labor and social welfare, said, "In many ways we already have a breakthrough.
sna: VaPaul Mavima, gurukota remuZimbabwe rinoona nezvevashandi vehurumende, zvemabasa ese munyika nekubatsira vagari vanoshaiwa, vakati, "Nenzira dzakawanda takakagona kubvotorera nekukunda panyaya iyi. Vatungamiriri vevashandi vagamuchira zvizhinji zvetakavarongedzera, uye vari kuti: Ngatichitauriranayi nukuonesana kuti zvichazofambiswa seyi."

en: The leaders of the workers have to a very large extent welcomed this package and they are only saying: Lets discuss how it is going to be implemented."
sna: Vatungamiriri vevashandi vagamuchira zvizhinji zvetakavarongedzera, uye vari kuti: Ngatichitauriranayi nukuonesana kuti zvichazofambiswa seyi."

en: The teachers and government are expected to meet in coming days to resume negotiations.

en: Meanwhile, students wait to resume their studies months after the COVID-19 pandemic forced their schools to close.
